title: Nice
review: its one of the Attractions in jaisalmer it has golden centophs of all kings and queens and they look pretty good .

title: One of 3 highlights
review: its unique with history of suti in several hundreds years ago. Only thing is there was lots of poo scattered on the site and walks could be better

title: Hidden attraction
review: This is a beautiful place close to Jaisalmer town. It is not part of the normal Jaisalmer tour routine. It has many umbrella ( Centophs) structures depicting the tombs of the royal family members. Some have been damaged in the earthquake which hit the region some years ago. Overall nice historic place to visit.

title: Family visit
review: This is very interesting place. A patch of greenery in the middle of desert. Te memorials built to various kings are very nice.

title: Interesting
review: Bada Bagh is an old graveyard just outside the city, but it can be easily reached by taxi or tuktuk. it worths a quick visit, we didn't take any guide, but the tuktuk driver has been very kind and told us some info about the place.

title: Cenotaphs and a garden
review: Its located about 10 Kms from the city center, Bada Bagh or big garden was built by the Ruler Maharawal Jait Singh. He though to build a garden in the middle of the desert.

title: Perfect for sunset
review: Expect a lot of tourists around, but this is incredible place to see the setting sun. There is an entry fee that you have to pay.

title: Best for sunset
review: It's very nice place for sunset and photographs. The best time is afternoon or at sunset time.

title: Beautiful cenotaphs in ugly environment
review: The cenotaphs are pretty beautiful and one of the many testaments of the old Kings and their power/riches. However, the surroundings are very ugly (industrial landscape of wind turbines) and do damage the mystical vibe the monuments would otherwise have given.

title: Great photographic sight!
review: Wonderful domes, arches, carved pillars and historical significance. A photographers dream! Be careful to eliminate the wind turbines in the background. Sunset is a great time to let the light create varying effects, colors and shadows against the stone, but don't expect to include the sunset in your temple shots, it sinks below the opposite horizon. Sunrise would be better. There is a minimal entry and camera fee.

title: some good spots for photos or photoshoot
review: Nothing much to explore at the place. If you are looking for some good scenic photos or a photo shoot then give a visit.

title: Iconic place of jaisalmer
review: A very good place to visit in jaisalmer..lot of chatariya..made memories of old king...must visit this place

title: Mesmerising Bada Bagh
review: An awesome place to watch sunset and doing photography. From Jaisalmer fort it's just 5 km. Just take an auto rickshaw n you are all set to go.

title: Peaceful
review: Not a crowded place. There is a fee to visit this place residents pay one fee and foreigners another. These cenotaph are beautifully crafted . Must visit once , need about 30 min and wear closed shoes .

title: Good place,but could be avoided if in hurry
review: The place is like a deserted land in the city between solar panels along the side. The place is good but does not have much history to be attracted. A guide will make a video of you with some music at behind.

title: Beautiful place
review: Awesome and beautiful place to visit with family...

title: Intricate architecture and intriguing history
review: Go here to admire the architecture and the stores of royals. Ask for Raju guide (Raju Mali) he will make the experience even more interesting.

title: Awesome Rajasthan
review: Morning is the ideal time. Though there is nothing except these monuments, but after seeing this place you have to say wow!what a place

title: Beautiful places
review: this is the place where you can took lot of pic ,historical place where lot of king, s family members funeral has done, good place to visit

title: Review of bada bagh
review: One of the best ancient places which is  a must place to visit,and the pictures would be lovely to be taken in

title: Beautiful
review: The buildings are so interesting.  Many royal people’s elaborate tombs.  For a small fee, a guide will tell you the history of this place, where once stood many gardens.

title: Quite expensive
review: Its a nice place but this is not properly maintained as this belongs to royal family , Price they are charging is not worth because of maintenance.

title: Nice
review: Nice palace . Good quit Not far nice desert view. Fron there nice Sunset. By Taxi 150 rupees. Hope u like

title: Must Visit Place in Jaisalmer
review: Don't miss this place. When u go there better to take guide so that u know the importance of the place. I will not disclose it. It's belongs to royal family now also. Many Hindi film shooting has done here.You can go with bike also, entry fee is 100rs per person. This place is 6-7 km from Jaisalmer Fort

title: Spectacular
review: Bada Bagh in Jaisalmer was described to us simply as “sunset point” by our driver. But as you arrive you realize how beautiful and vast the structures are. Highly recommend a visit.

title: Nice..but poorly managed.
review: Place is nice but  to see a good place in shambles due to lack of interest from the government and the present king..feels bad..

title: Bara Bagh
review: One of the famous place to visit in Jaisalmer as it’s have lot of history attach to it.. always take a guide and our guide Mr Ravi was a great person and had given us a lot of backgrounder this place.

title: Amazing sunset
review: This was an incredibly interesting place to visit with the most spectacular views with the sunset and our guide Raj gave us a great account of the history of the place.

title: Burial Ground for Jaisalmer Royal Family
review: We hired a guide who explained that on each tomb if there is king on the horse with 2 legs up mean he died in battle field. Otherwise it is normal death.

title: Worth a visit
review: Place is good for taking pictures.  Some part of bollywood movies were done here.  Ticket cost you around 100 rs per head

title: Historical monument
review: I have never seen a momument based on the places where humans were burned after death and temples constructed there in their memory.

title: Good
review: It's in way to desert camps so if going for desert camps it's highly recommended visit. I would strongly recommend available services of local guide (they charged me just Rs 100 - about USD 1.50) to understand the perspective

title: Sunset at Bada Bagh
review: Chatris, Monuments resembling umbrella, looks mesmerizing during the sunset. The combination of the Gold stone and the setting sun making the whole environment shine like gold provides an unique experience.

title: Ok
review: It is royals cemetery. It was Sunday and over crowded. Can avoid this place. Nothing extraordinary just one more royal stuff. Entrance fee is very high compared to have nothing much to see.

title: Very well thought cremation ground
review: The place has samadhi of Royal Family . It’s called Bada Bagh as the ruler of Jaiselmer developed a Bagh with many varieties of fruit and vegetables plants and made the area green in desert. This area is developed as cremation ground , and there are Samadhi with name and photo of that ruler who passed away . All the s

title: Jaisalmer - Bada Bagh - Nice photographic location with historic essence
review: Bada Bagh would be the first outskirt tourist location in Jaisalmer. This is open 24 hours and comes with a ticketing entry. I would recommend no guide is required as it is asmall place to be covered and the history is laid down in stones to read. There are no audio tours for foreigners so they can opt for a guide if required for may be 100 INR. You wont find anything to eat near the location as it is an outskirt location and in desert. It is however an excellent photographic location with different avenues to click pictures and sink into the historic relevance. Carry a bottle of water as weather can be pretty dehydrating.

title: Mr. G
review: Any cemetery of ancient Kings is pretty special in India. While not well-developed for tourism, this desert site ( about 6 kilometers from Jaisalmer) impresses with its number and variety of sandstone carved domes, columns, and stelae. On the route of the old Silk Road, it's a good reminder of the reverence shown rulers in this harsh environment.

title: Calm place for an evening / Sunset view
review: Dusty, open, chilly...

title: Rs.150 to visit is not worth at all
review: Would recommend door se darshan of this place as its not worth Rs.150 per person.

title: Must visit, best place at Jaisalmer for portrait photoshoot
review: Very offbeat place. Came into notice while going through internet searching. 6 km outside the city. Very quite. Tourists are very few. Entry fees are high.Very good place for portrait photography.

title: Nice Architecture
review: Bada Bagh located outside Jaisalmer on the way to Sam Sand Dunes is a collection of cenotaphs or tombs of the royalty who ruled Jaisalmer. The place being not inside the city of Jaisalmer is not much visited by tourists. The architecture of the cenotaphs is quiet beautiful and the monuments provide some good photographic opportunities.

title: Not worth the entrance fee
review: This is a set of cenotaphs built to honor the dead - it is hardly a pleasant place to be in...this was more like a crematorium in ancient times & there are bat & bird droppings all over. The wall carvings are beautiful ( as usual ) & the lineup of these domed structures looks impressive. But not worth the entrance fee & more than 10 mins. of time.

title: Beauty at its Peak...
review: The most beautiful Architecture of Jaisalmer.....Bada Bagh...awesome work..........it will be good if you visit during  sunset.........

title: Good place to see
review: Good place to see . It's one time visit place . We have visited along with family enjoyed our trip .

title: " Sunset point "
review: Bada Bagh, also called Barabagh (literally Big Garden) is a garden complex about 6 km north of Jaisalmer on the way to Ramgarh, in the state of Rajasthan in India.

title: Interesting and unique
review: This place is very interesting. You can see stone statues of royal families describing the family inside butifull structures.

title: Bada Bagh
review: this one is also a historic place in jaisalmer, and well maintained by government. if you have time and it's a evening time, then this place is best for time spent and photography. you have to pay for visit this place. architecture of this place is incredible.

title: Royal Cemetery - Well maintained, beautiful work
review: Bada Bagh is situated on a small hill. Although a cemetery, this has many a "chattris" built for royal family members. The chattris are well carved in yellow sandstone and give a picturesque view. There is an entry ticket to Badabagh is Rs.100 for adults and Rs.100 for camera.

title: Nice architecture
review: We have visited this place while returning from Sam sun dune. It will come on the way to Jaisalmeir City.

title: Interesting ruins
review: We walked around the memorials around sunset. There are good photo opportunities and the place has a peaceful feel to it. The carving on the memorials was also interesting. We enjoyed the peace and quiet of the desert air.

title: Badabag Jaisalmer
review: Nice place to visit . Supab view nice senetops very beautiful and interesting place. Nice vegetable garden . Small river nice highly recommended

title: Photogenic spot
review: A good spot for taking memorable phots.After visiting fort u will not see anything  special but it's good for photography.

title: Royal tombs
review: Be sure to make the journey out from Jaisalmer to see these. Interesting to see how many wives were entombed along with their husbands. Unfortunately, they have now built a wind farm on the hill behind them, so you have to dodge  these to get decent photos, but still a great place to visit. You need transport to get there.

title: Picturesque
review: We visited it while on our way to camel safari. Worth a visit. Beautiful chhatris - monuments to Jaisalmer royals.

title: Ethereal sunset point
review: The beautifully carved cenotaphs or war memorials stretch across the sands atop a small hillock, as if carved out of ivory and strewn in the desert. A great viewing point for the evening sunset, the structures take on a translucent caramel hue in the fading dusk...juxtaposed against wind-farm turbines, all around in the distance, Bada Bagh has a magical quality to it. A must-visit in the evening hours.

title: Nice place
review: Real old cenotaph from Royal family, old heritage building and nice place to walk around there with peaceful with nature

title: Feel the Royalty at Bada Baag
review: This is a must visit spot of Jaisalmer. It is just a few kilometres from Jaisalmer and looks really interesting as you reach there. I'll recommend travellers to do a bike trip to Bada Baag, as I did. Rent a bike and start your Jaisalmer tour with Bada Baag. Everywhere you look, sand, windmills and these royal golden chattris (cenotaphs). Simply amazing.

title: Nice
review: All those Maharaja families places they have built and Rajasthan government have maintained well enough so people can visit and know more.

title: Visit if you have time to spare
review: Its nothing but the tombs of royal family, place is famous for its royal chatris or cenatophs but you will find such structures all over Rajasthan, nothing great or specific to boast about this place.

title: Dull
review: Ok for a few photos in the evening. But i found it to be underwhelming both from an architectural and historical perspective.

title: Royal Cenotaphs - Bada Bagh
review: Nice Place to Visit in Jaisalmer. The architecture is wonderful. Bada Bagh situated About 6 kilometers to the north of Jaisalmer this place is royal cenotaphs of the Maharajas of Jaisalmer.

title: Super place
review: Nice and super place to visit sight seeing in jaisalmer now day there is also a beautiful lake , beautiful and night architecture

title: Beautiful Place
review: Beautiful place to visit nice and beautiful carving,  great history of Royal Families.. And they is also small private mango garden...

title: Chatris and a surprising garden in the desert
review: The place is lovely, on a small hillock and with a lush garden (mango grove) and waterbody on the side.  The chatris are beautiful and the place has a mystical feel ... super photo ops here and if you like old architecture then it's worth the visit.

title: Just a Memorial!
review: Entry fee is 100 rupees and for mobile camera it is additional 150 rupees.Its a memorial of the royal family.Frankly speaking there is nothing much to see here.The name is because there is a garden where there are lots of mangoes and other trees which have grown even though it's a desert and because it's big.There is a lake nearby.The place is not maintained that well and you can hardly find any people here.But if you are fond of architecture you can come here. It's hot so don't forget to carry umbrella and cap.

title: Sun set evening
review: It’s a beautiful place to spend some time in the evening. It is 6 km from the main city.  The area is surrounded with wind mills and have one lake.

title: Best place
review: Nice place for photo graphy , great history , must visit this place i n Jaisalmer I took bike and visit with my wife  , high recommended

title: Nice place to sit and enjoy the view.
review: Good place with Authentic view of windwills one side lake at other end.

title: Collection of cenotaphs
review: The place is located about 10 kms from he city towards the windmills. The entry is a tad pricey but that lets maintain these unique structures so worth it! One of the few places which offer greenery in the otherwise dry landscape of Jaisalmer. The buildings have 2 styles if architecture with an interesting history for each. The backgrounds make ideal locations for taking pictures and can be visited time permitting.

title: If you have time..
review: About 7kms from the city. You can see many royal chhatris with finely carved ceilings and equestrain statues of formal rulers. There is a small entrance fee.

title: Wedding photography
review: The cenotaphs at Bada Bagh are impressive. Well worth a visit. We took a tuctuc and the 6km flew past until we saw the cenotaphs from the road. Go early morning when there are less people if you like photos of just the buildings. It is popular with wedding couples to have their photographs taken there.

title: Bada bagh
review: Bada bagh has some beatutiful scructures which are made by royal family of jaisalmer... it comes on the way from jaisalmer to tanot mata.  7 to 8 km from jaisalmer. Has entry fees

title: The royal cenotaphs
review: This is a place commemorating the death of the members of the royal family symbolised in the form of cenotaphs ranging in different sizes with each one dedicated for a dead member of a royal family.This area is surrounded by a lot of windmills giving a nice scenic look..a perfect place to sit and enjoy the sunset away from the Jaisalmer city.Entry ticket is 100rs and also requires paying for the car parking.

title: Interesting enough but not great
review: Interesting to see the ruins. Something different than seen elsewhere in India. But really not worth the Rs150 entrance fee. We did not pay to take photos. If you’re short on time, I’d give it a miss.

title: Bada baag
review: It's bit different side of city but it's completely worth to visit. best time is to visit in sunrise or sunset. As jaisalmer is known as desert and dry heat or warm weather it's always hot in noon. For photoshoot for landscapes this is perfect place.

title: A bit desappointed
review: There are no signs to Bada Bagh (I only could get there because of the Google Maps) and when I get there I felt that the place was abbandoned and not well cared. But, if you want to kill some time in Jaisalmer (there is not much too see, anyway), I recommed.

title: Isolated and deserted
review: Bada Bagh is a series of royal cenotaphs dedicated to the Maharajas of Jaisalmer state. Bada bagh is about 8 kms from Jaisalmer and the only way to reach is by hiring a tuk-tuk or car. It is better to book your vehicle for a round trip as Bada bagh lies in a deserted area and you will not find any mode of transportation on your way back. Entry fees is required to enter Bada Bagh and there are separate charges for camera. There are guides available who will show you around, even though I did not want one, I had to take as they were very insisting and wouldn’t leave me alone. I did a mistake as I did not book a round trip and the guide dropped me back to Jaisalmer on his motorcycle, for which I had to pay 300 rupees extra.

title: “MUST VISIT IN JAISALMER “
review: Bada Bagh is some km away from main city but going out there is worth it !

title: Heritage in shambles
review: Bada bagh has magnificent architecture and is a treat to eyes! However the place is in shambles with damaged structures and stairways and may even be risky while moving to higher sides! It is very badly maintained despite a fee collected by govt! Considering the amount of tourists that visit this place it does need better upkeep!

title: Add to itinerary if you are a history buff
review: You may not find this place so appealing at all unless you take serious interest with Indian History... this place is nothing but a very large cemetery which accommodate many generations of a particular royal family... You have to step up along the slope walking to visit the actual place from the car parking area, however, once you reach to the top, the view down below is quite breathtaking. Sad to see the remnants are not so well preserved or maintained. There are no strict vigilance to prevent shutterbugs and selfie-bugs from further destroying the history and disregarding the importance of the place itself. If you would like to know about the place, there is not enough quality guides available who could tell you something meaningful about the place, so better you do little bit of study over the internet before visiting to make the visit more meaningful. For senior people stepping up the place may be somewhat difficult, so if you are accompanying someone, it is advisable that they rest in the car and not to venture getting upwards on the slope...

title: Bada bagh
review: Chatri was awsm..bt i dont think there shoulb a ticket...there was neither dringking water or any other facility..neithr this place was maintaind...plz visit either erly morng or eveng

title: Royal Cenotaphs
review: This place is basically a cremation place with one chatri dedicated to one royalty.

title: Excellent place to visit
review: I went with a friend to see the Royal Cenotaphs of Jaisalmer. It is a very old and interesting place. Also great place for photography. Get a taxi and go see it's well worth the visit

title: Architectural marvel
review: Located 6 kilometers away from Jaisalmer on Ramgarh road, this is a mesmerizing site. It is a cluster of finely crafted cenotaphs belonging to the royal clan.

title: Royal fimilies are here forever !
review: It is a place where royal family members' history is stored forever. Some Chattris which were built by hindus over 400 years ago and some are built 250 years ago but history worth knowing. good place

title: "Beautiful"
review: Near jaisalmer it's call Barabagh

title: Remote and lonely
review: Surrounded by dry farm land, this place felt quiet, almost reverential.  We saw only a few other visitors.  It took about an hour to casuallky poke around the sight.  We did not pay for any guide an d don't think we missed much by not having one.  You can get the story of this place on thge intwrnet.

title: Beautiful Place
review: It is a collection of chattris or tombs of the ruling dynasty from Jaisalmer.They all look beautiful in this isolated desert area.It is so peaceful and lovely to walk around especially early morning or evening.

title: Costly and less impressive
review: It is ridiculous that royals would charge money to show you their creation ground. Per person entry is high with less activities and no value for money. You can see similar chatris or cenotough free of charge at jaipur

title: Great heritage
review: Near Jaisalmer, this place offers great view of desert and Fort and Wind mills in back drop. Heritage place.

title: An interesting place but too expensive for what it is
review: OK, look it's a cemetery, pure and simple.  Yes it's got a lot of interesting structures but at the end of the day, it's a cemetery, and at 150 rupee and 100 rupee if you have a camera, it's an expensive cemetery.

title: Unique View
review: Bada Bagh is group of chhatri monuments in Jaiselmer. There is about 100 INR entry fees for Indian and 150 for foreigners. The place has a wonderful view. Must visit place however, this place need some steps on the uphill monuments. They are charging lot of money but I do not see where it is spent.

title: Lovely place
review: We hired some old pushbikes and road out to Bada bagh which is about 5kms out of town. Really fun afternoon. 150 rupees to visit. Beautiful architecture, not much written in english but nice place to sit and relax

title: BaraBagh
review: Its a lovely place- A must visit for all travellers.  We had a simple guide who gave us insights and stories of the place.  Definately worth a visit.

title: Expensive Entry....
review: The entry to the cremation ground for Royal family is ₹100/- per person + if u carry ur Mobile inside it is + ₹100/-  per phone. The guard told us the rates are decided by the king of Jaisalmer. OK its his private land he can fix up the price but considering it tourist attraction which benifets the whole city he should work out a affordable entry fee. He is a king... He already is blessed with ample wealth.

title: Amazing locatoin
review: This is located about 12 km from Jaisalmer city. This is basically a cremation ground for Royal family. There is an entry fee of 100 Rs per person and 100 INR for mobile phone which i dont think is justified. Good location for photography.

title: Tomb - Lots of Pillars and Weddings
review: A collection of domed cenotaphs too many to count make a nice destination at sunset. If you are lucky you will get to see wedding shoots there that match bollywood in colour and content. Worth the short trip out of the town

title: AMAZING LOCATION
review: This is located about 6 km from Jaisalmer city. This is basically a cremation ground for Royal family. There is an entry fee of 100 Rs per person and 100 INR for mobile phone which i dont think is justified. Good location for photography.

title: not properly maintained
review: Bada bagh is a big tourism attraction in Jaisalmer, situated outskirts of the city Bada bagh contains no. of monuments , but it looks like nobody cares those. No approach road to the monuments , elderly and small kids found it very difficult to reach there as they have to climb on a small slippery hill without any stair. very ignored place, if maintain may be a good tourist attraction.

title: interesting place, but not well maintained
review: It is quite an interesting place to visit, but lacks basic maintenance & facilities for the tourists.

title: Beautiful
review: Worth a visit. Beautiful structures.  Many of the structures are crumbling because of earthquakes in the last decade. Would recommend good shoes and the ability to climb.

title: Memories of Royal Family
review: These are stone structures built in memory on death of a royal family member. A few structures were destroyed in an earthquake.

title: Unbelievable.
review: These are Cenotaphs or Chhatris, Memorial's for the members of the Royal Family who died. Beautiful architecture and definitely worth seeing. Tour Guides around, and for different European languages as well.

title: Must visit for architecture freaks
review: Bada bagh is Cenotaphs for the kings of Jaisalmer... the bagh (garden) is well maintained and green.. its a bingo if u see green vegetation in jaisalmer... the bagh is surrounded with wind mills... its serene n has lots of history associated with it...

title: Best views at sunset
review: This place has heritage architecture too.

title: Can skip
review: It’s just a graveyard of kings n queens.entrance fee is quite high.nothing much here to do.good place for photography.seeing sunset  here is not worth....

title: Cenotaph... I mean seriously!!
review: Just be awestruck and watch the beauty of this historical place, seems as if the royal era would come alive in a moment. A perfect destination chosen by Bollywood directors. Its serenity gives the edge over other monuments.

title: Nice and scary place
review: Nice and scary place. It is because it is a burial ground of Royal families of Jaisalmer. A nice place to visit

title: Ancient Monument
review: A place situated away from Jaisalmer city.You must visit this place in the evening where you can have a view of sun set. Day time visit is not advisable due to heat.

title: Heavenly sunsets
review: Bada Bagh is a must go if you are keen on good photography sessions and some quiet moments watching the horizon. The sunset offers a splendid view. Exquisite carvings on chhatris will remind you of a bygone era.

title: Interesting place , disappointed by conservation effort
review: Interesting place to visit. There is a history associated with it . Better take a local guide for same.

title: Beautiful, just beautiful.
review: Innumerable Cenotaphs, Windmills background, greenery ahead, fresh breeze, its just the best place for photography from any angle. Beautifully constructed. Better go on sunrise, as there will be less crowd.

title: Picturesque location
review: This is historical place, one should visit. I felt 100 RS per person as a entry fee is little high.

title: Classic monument ....historical place
review: really a very good historical monument which connects you to jaisalmer kingdom members and stories kindly do a guide to understand the things better as this place is very different from fort

title: Cenotaphs
review: Not all of them are in good condition but it is an amazing sight to see so many cenotaphs together in one place. Go early to avoid mid day heat.

title: Photo stop only
review: For tourists it’s charged ₹100/- for per person and photo shoot or camera  you should pay more 100/- free parking is available. Local guide is available they gives all information about place.

title: Nice Place to visit
review: Visit to Bada Bagh was great , the Chhateries of Royal family of Jaisalmer and premises is well maintained and clean.

title: A beautiful historic place
review: A beautiful place but only if you take a guide, else you will be just looking at some old architecture. Good to know the history. Interesting place.

title: Solemn place with some history - Worth the visit
review: These are monuments erected in memory of old kings (and also cremation grounds). We accepted the offer of the local guide and he gave us a good background of this place. It was interesting but morbid to hear about the “hatti” (wives jumping into the fire at the death of their king husbands) but that is the history.

title: Slightly offbear
review: Located some 5 kms outside town. Good location to go to experience a quite sunset. Location at that time makes for some good photo opportunities.

title: Dont visit this place
review: They charge for entry n cameras and the place is not clean.

title: Dont waste you money on this
review: We reached the spot but after learning that there is an entry fee of Rs. 100 per visitor. we decides to skip the spot. Its not worth the money. Instead, I used a high zoom camera to capture the site right from the entry point. This place can simple be skipped as there is no activity there and entry fee is exorbitant for the experience it offers. Avoid.

title: Cenotaphs to former rulers
review: The setting sun really brings out the golden colours of these memorials to Jaisalmer's former rulers.  The photo opportunities are blotted by the surrounding wind turbines

title: needs better facilities and maintenance
review: Nice view and unique experience. more people need to visit this. They need to build a toilet here especially if you have female visitors here.

title: Beautiful Historic Architecture Site
review: Looking at the very unique architecture and listening to the history of these structures from our tour guide I found our visit to Bada Bagh very interesting. It's also a super sunset viewpoint.

title: Amazing view of cenotaph made from yello stone resembles gold
review: Great experience it was, beautiful heritage place and good for photographic activity. Its near from city so everyone should visit. Although it has entry of 100 rs (for indian)  per person but its not too much to visit such beautiful place.

title: bad experience
review: poorly managed, bad behaviour from staff,need better transport fecilities. Better if you go for sunrise or sunset

title: Average Big Garden
review: This translates to Big Gardens. However a steep entry fee of Rs 100 is a deterrent. Anyway one can visit if have lots of time

title: Worst place
review: This place is not maintained at all and they charge 100 rs for a ticket for Indians which is much more than the forts in Jaisalmer which are very well maintained. Don't go here!

title: waste of time and money
review: this place is situated around 5KM from jaisalmer city, it has entry ticket of Rs 100 and they charge additional Rs 100 for camera. Additionally you will have to spend Rs 150 for guide, if you want to know history behind this place.

title: A waste of time and money
review: Considering what it has to offer I found the entry price too much. There is nothing other than the cenotaphs and there are no sign boards also. For camera you have to pay extra and this means you will just end up walking across some structure with no idea about who it is dedicated to.

title: Bada bagh jaisalmer
review: I personally don't recommend to visit this place.

title: Royal cenotaphs
review: These cenotaphs are built by the royals of Jaisalmer. The landscape is wonderfully rugged, mostly barren save a large patch of farmland with windmills spinning in the backdrop. nestled in these settings, the ochre coloured cenotaphs look marvellous! some of them are in ruin. The complex also consists of four temples. The biggest con for this place is the entry fee....they charge INR 100 for a camera (even a cellphone camera is separately charged!) in addition to an entrance fee. This is really hard on visitors as the place does offer beautiful subjects for photography. I also noticed that despite a guard being posted at the entrance, and couple of "guides" there, broken bottles and refuse on the premises.....a sad thing! however, I do recommend this place for three things - the landscape, the quietness and the buildings.

title: Hindu n Muslim architecture can b seen
review: A picturesque place, worth a visit! Can b completed in 15-20mins. It has the biggest patch of greenery that can be seen at Jaisalmer.

title: Tourist
review: Nice place to visit in the evening. Can see sunset. It is built in memory of Maharaja and also their wife as sati.

title: nice crimatorium but poorly maintained...
review: authority is just interested in taking money from people but not maintaining the beautiful crematorium. the Idea and construction is quite good but very dirty.

title: Pricey, Unkempt
review: This is a burial ground for King and doesn't live up to it's name as far as entry price tag is concerned. It looks like even ghosts are making money for the kings. Nothing much to see here. Better avoid. Avoid the guide there.

title: interesting
review: We went there for sunset which was lovely and different from forts and palaces.  Not a lot to see though once you've walked through.  Great for photographs.

title: Sand stone cenotaphs on desert
review: These sand stone cenotaphs look really good with the desert all around it. But the admission charges are unnecessarily steep.

title: Royal crematorium
review: This place is for royal family crematorium, place is around 6 KM far from main city. but worth visiting. this is the first time i visited crematorium for royal family. it is very interesting.

title: Canopies of different sizes and shapes!
review: This place is just a reminiscent of dead nobles of Jaisalmer, who ruled over this desert.  Nothing great about this place but architecture of few of these is pretty impressive, having intricate designs.

title: Not much interested  place.
review: Bada Bag..not much interested place.

title: Place for cremation of Members of Royal Family
review: It is basically a place for cremation of Members of Royal Family. Some monumnets were built in memory of all those members in royal family of Jaisalmer.

title: Royal Cenotaphs
review: Nice place to visit.. entry fee is Rs.100/- per person.The place is located a little away from the city.This place hosts the tombs of many rulers of Jaisalmer. A great location to see the architectural works in sandstone.This can be done along with Tanot mata temple and Longewala.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Nice place to visit in the evening to watch the sunset. Little bit far from the city but an awesome place.

title: Picturesque
review: A dramatic set of cremation cenotaphs

title: Peaceful place
review: The sunset is a very nice moment to walk around this place. You feel peace and it is a good place for introspection.

title: Beautiful Royal Cenotaphs.
review: Beautiful place to visit just outside Jaisalmer.

title: an icon of jaisalmer
review: badabagh is one among many icons of jaisalmer. this is the place where the jaisal kings were cremeated. it still stands as the provate property of the raja family. once you visit this, please dont forget to hire a guide and ask about the custom that the kings and people once followed there. The guide that i took, Mr.Aryan is an excellent guy and his contributions were excellent to make the visit a memorable one.

title: beautiful
review: It is beautiful & remarkable spot yet heartwarming.

title: Rajasthan trip
review: Beautiful place to capture picture, interesting history of king and their Empire Graves. Baagh is not accessible for visitors, this is not fair as they charge 100rs. To visit place.

title: Go for sunset
review: This place is worth a visit. It was featured in many movies.

title: Nice but not worth the money
review: So I am not sure if the guy at the entrance thought he could play with us but he charged us $20 for the car. Our driver looked back at us and translated and we didn't think it was worth the money. You can see it from afar and there are some windmills surrounding it. There are some great spots for pictures but the tour around it all shouldn't take longer than 30 min.

title: halting spot while going towards sand dunes
review: Expectations were high as per reviews & travelogues but disappointed  in 1st look.

title: A place of Royal Cenotaphs!!
review: Nice place to visit.. entry fee is Rs.100/- per person.. they did not charge us for camera.. we hired a guide to understand the history behind this Royal cenotaphs.. the guide even took pics and even shot a 1 min video..

title: Great place of Architectural Marvel
review: This place is located a little away from the city (10 KM). his place hosts the tombs of many rulers of  Jaisalmer. A great location to see the architectural works in sandstone. There is an entry fee for visiting this place but its worth the money.

title: Dull location
review: No on was around when we reached this location.  Tourism in Rajasthan is really dying. Looks like no one wants to visit these places anymore.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place also called hunted Village must see location my family has enjoyed a lot.  Recommend  to others to visit at least for some time.

title: Hillorious cenotops
review: Really nice sculpture in the memory of Maharawals of Jaisalmer who fought bravely to protect while Bharatvarsh.

title: not a must see but ok
review: a repeatative structure out on a dusty hillside over looking a dried up lake. High entance price for foriegners of 150 entrance and another 200 camera. It's not worth more than 100 tops so say you don't have camera. The site is neglected and stark so not sure what they do with the entrance fee. Drive past unless you are bored.

title: You are better off visiting the Sunset point
review: Drove here for a sunset view. The only thing you are looking at is huge wind turbines in the desert. Paid 400 rupees to get in and we were disappointed with the view. We drove back and got to the Sunset point, only costs you 150 rupees and has a stunning view of the Jaisalmer fort and city.

title: AMAZING!!!
review: It's difficult to arrive with public transport, but it is really amazing!!!

title: Royal Cenotaphs that are not well maintained!
review: Bada Bagh is about 6kms from the main city centre and though architecturally is beautiful and a great place for pics but lacks information for a tourist.Also not being maintained properly and prices to enter are quite high.About Rs.100/- for Indians and extra charges for a camera (think it was Rs.100/- for a mobile camera and Rs.200/- for a video camera)

title: Sunset delight!
review: A place of Cenotaphs that are quite a view. The history behind these structures are also interesting although it is quite a short one. The guide we had hired was a knowledgeable one and he made the viewing even more fun.

title: Old Cenotaph
review: It is very near to Jaisalmer city. The place is quite interesting after the death of Maharawal  Jaisal Singh his son built a garden next to the lake and also built a cenotaph (chatri) for his father, later on there were many more cenotaph was built for other Rajputs. The place is nice but not well maintain. Entry fee is little high as per this place.

title: A nice place surrounded by ugly windmills.
review: Perhaps we did not prepare well, we were not in the right mood and we were wrongly complaining about all the broken glass that was in the tombs everywhere.

title: Cool!!!
review: Place quite cool and on the way from Jaisalmer to Ramgarh, if you are photo lover please visit this place.

title: Photogenic location...
review: Just perfect location for candid photography.. beautifully carved domes, a must visit which gives you a peaceful experience with natural beauty.

title: Enjoyed the tranquility of wandering these
review: Beautiful constructed and ornate carvings.

title: Only for photography!
review: It is situated 8km outside jaisalmer.The place is quiet and beautiful.But there's not much to see here.

title: Tomb shaped Cenotaphs that are also called Chattris...
review: Bada Bagh or Bara Bagh literally means a Big Garden in local language, however is nowhere close to that. It infact is like a burial ground of the royal family., for the kings and queens who passed away. While the first cenotaph was built in the sixteenth century, the tradition continues till date... The last tomb constructed was of Maharaval Jawahar Singh which was left incomplete as his son who ascended the throne died within a year's time. This was considered as bad luck and the tradition of building cenotaphs was hence discontinued.

title: Visit just for Pictures
review: It's a bit far place from jaisalmer main city. And if you use public transport like Auto Rickshaw, they will charge u like hell. They take advantage of lack of connectivity & transport availability.

title: Royal cenotaphs
review: it is situated 6 kms away from Jaisalmer on way to Ramgarh.

title: Sunset spot
review: I found this place quite a lovely stop for the sunset.

title: Good point for clicking pictures
review: There are royal cenothaphs in bada bagh. It is good place for having Maximum photograhs . Not great as other places in Jaisalmer but visit this place for clicking pictures

title: Best For Sunset Point
review: This bada bagh place is very famous as a sunset point in jaisalmer and in the evening lots of tourist and people go there and see the sunset and enjoy the cremation ground of royal maharajas it is very interesting place to visit.

title: Good
review: Jaisalmer to 7 km for was very good sunset point I really like so beautiful experience this place...

title: pretty overrated
review: The tickets are very high for the place, and it is located at 7km from jaisalmer. I also video charges are high, if you have money to waste visit this place

title: Bada Bagh
review: This is a memorial of earlier rulers of Jaisalmer. In other words, it is a Royal Shamshan Ghat. I was told that some bollywood films were shot there

title: Beautiful but not well maintained
review: From what I read and understood about this space, it is a memorial space. Generally most would regard this as a space of respect and treat is as such. After paying the entrance fee and walking around, I felt rather conflicted. The historic structures are beautiful and poetic yet around it, the amount of garbage and broken glass bottles can be disconcerting. Worth seeing but if you have a limited time in Jaisalmer, maybe consider going to see the other sites instead.

title: Not much
review: The place is beautiful but not well preserved. There are lots of garbage everywhere and of course people staring. It's can be part of Indian culture but it's aggressive.

title: The royal cenotaph of jaisalmer royal families
review: Rajasthan has a tradition of constructing cenotaph in memories of departed person and more so in case of Royal family.

title: Not maintained at all
review: Bada Bagh is a memorial place of all kings. Entry fee INR 100 per person and INR 100 for Camera chargers.

title: Royal Cenotaphs of Jaisalmer Rulars
review: It was nice attraction. CHATTRIES OR CENOTAPHS were built with jaisalmer yellow stone. Sarrounded by Bagh and a small river its look amazing.

title: Just another set of canopies
review: We were here around 11.30 am and were not too impressed by these set of canopies as we had already seen so many artistic ones, which are erected in memory of dead.

title: Very very different
review: It's been built alongside a lake and each stupa thing has been built in memory of a king and his wives and kids are buried around. It's a little away from the main jaisalmer dunes but worth a visit

title: Big Garden
review: Built by Maharaja Jait Singh, the garden is a memorial where the nobles and their families were cremated. It offers breathtaking sunrise and sunset views.

title: View
review: A badabaag place is superb for a new couple and it's so romantic and a place which famous for his view and looking so beautiful......

title: Beautiful monument in the desert
review: This was a beautiful and peaceful diversion outside Jaisalmer.  Gorgeous sandstone cenotaphs of past kings that were initially built in the 19th century.  No need for tour - just show up,and marvel at the beautiful structures.

title: very different place
review: It was having nice architecture and my kids loved to see all these buildings. there were a few local kids there who were playing pranks and saying that it is a hounted place. Nice experience

title: Unique place of jaisana
review: I can't say about in words how much beautiful place. This place is so beautiful and also a awesome place for new married couples. A best place for photoshoot. You can see many things at this place.

title: Sunset view
review: It's nearest sun set point in city. Can have a sunrise or sunset view from this point which opens as per timings. Can view city from it & it's near to village. Nothing more about it. Surrounding areas needs improvement. In evening u can enjoy cool breeze at the top.

title: Wedding shoots and what not :-)
review: This is photogenic! You would see young couples have pre/post wedding shoots. Enjoyed looking at borderline child bride and groom :-)

title: Cenotaphs of royal families
review: Beautiful monuments seem to appear in the middle of the desert. Golden stone monuments, impressive built in the memory of the deceased.

title: Great stop off
review: Go at sunset, it's very laid back, easy to walk around, and offers gorgeous photo opportunities. The best time seems to be at sunset when you can appreciate that these structures are memorials.

title: Unbelievable beauty
review: This place is located a at a little distance from the city & basically created in memories of the erstwhile rulers. Each Chattri, possibly made of sandstone, represents one ruler. However the whole complex - as a group look awesome.

title: Great Architecture in the heart of Desert
review: During our way to Sam dunes from Jaisalmer we visited this Royal place which was so beautiful having  great architectural & historical value.

title: Nothing much
review: On way to Tanot we stopped here. Its a huge cemetry of royals which looks more like ruins when you get closer. Good only for a quick photo op

title: Interesting little place , no info though
review: It's a little out of town,  but worth the trip. It's interesting to see but as with many such sights in India there is no information about it. Cenotaphs are in various states m some completely ruined, others almost intact.

title: Nice place
review: Very rough environment. Take eatables and water with you as spot is outside the city. very high ticket charges and 100 rs for photography although no one checks

title: Peace and quietness
review: Take some fruit and drinks and settle at the coast of the lake. So relaxing. And visit the temple at the left. A 5 minutes walk

title: Beautiful place - Guide is must
review: Bada Bagh is a beautifully built cemetery. Not disabled friendly. One must see it 'only' with a guide to build the whole perspective around it. Else, it is a very quiet place and won't mean much if you don't get the history right.

title: Nice place at sunset
review: 15 minutes suffices for a short visit, yet it's also a nice location to sit down and enjoy the sunset when you are staying overnight in Jaisalmer.

title: Interesting but poor maintenance
review: This is basically a cemetery - every ruler has a dome after death. Located outside the city this is a good drive. However the maintenance leaves a lot to be desired. Not very sure about safety too for single women or women in small groups as this place hardly is crowded.

title: Beautiful Place
review: We were here just after sunrise, with nobody around. It was great to explore for 1 hour. I found it more beautiful than many other attractions in the city.

title: Good
review: we are stopped outside bada bagh by a man and charged 100 rs per person and told us that he is giving concession by not charging 100 rs separately for mobile and show us the board where price was written but didnt provide any ticket.It looks like they are cheating tourists.

title: A Historic Place
review: I visited Bada Bagh It's a place where We could  find cenotaph of Royal family of Jaisalmer. Some of them were damaged due to earthquake however most of them are intact. A good view of wind Mills can be seen there. explore the place

title: Good but not maintained
review: This place is around 20 mins from Jaisalmer. Entry fee Rs 100. But absolutely not worth. The designs and carvings are good but most of them are in a broken condition.

title: Nice place !
review: This place has been made  in the memory of all royal family members of Jaisalmer. You can see all king's and queen's graves here.

title: Good
review: Was really nice beautiful sunset was really nice was good experience thank you so much I really recommend this place

title: Good SunSet point
review: It comes under must visit attraction in Jaisalmer. Its a good point to watch Sun set. A very nice architecture.

title: Must to visit with good guide
review: Its a must to visit place but no use of it if don't take guide. its small place spread in  just a km space, good to know about cremanation of Raja's family.

title: This place has a strange uniquenes
review: A small yet unusual and unique place. We went there early afternoon but the Sun was quite harsh and sand was blowing with the wind right on our face... irony: I still liked it. The way they are grouped, the architecture, the carving, the golden stone shining against the sun light and sand. Its quite different from forts and palaces. I am sure we would have enjoyed more if the sun was not as harsh but we got some awesome pictures. Sun glasses, hat, scarf is a must.

title: Must visit
review: The mesmerizing and haunting beauty of the Chhatris remain for a long times. Situated outside the city, the place gets few visitors. However, the stark emptiness of the surroundings and the grandeur in death makes a mind blowing combination. Spend some time with a  local guide to understand the significance of  the place.

title: A place of archeological importance. Lot of old idols of different ages have been excavated and  a nice place but better
review: Should go in evening. I liked the place for its archaeological value . I heard that nice sunset point ,better to go in afternoon after sunshine  as its totally exposed area .

title: Beautiful
review: October 2016 : Very under rated by the locals. But a very good place for photography. The limestone reflects colours of gold if you are there during day time, preferably in noon.

title: Memorial of Jaisalmer Royals
review: Bada Bagh the memorial of Jaisalmer royals. A guide described us the story behind it. The name came from the garden situated near this place. 4-5 memorials were slightly damaged. A place  worth visiting.

title: Poorly maintained
review: There is no information, no walking path and rubbish dumped really badly maintained for the ticket price they charge not worth it.

title: Amazig place!
review: Besides the fort and the lake, this is a MUST in Jaisalmer, 10 minutes drive from the fort. It's a complex of tombs but it is not only  for history lovers, the place is just amazing

title: Good
review: Good place to visit. Less crowdy and best part is that near to this place u can see lot of wind mills.

title: Nothing much to see
review: Basic design same as rajasthan. The guide are all having poor knowledge. Ticket entry and camera charges are too high looking for the place.

title: Aa average place, poorly maintained
review: This place is memorial for kings. The location is bit out of city. The entry fee is slightly exorbitant at Rs 100 each for the level of maintenance. We went here to witness the sunset, which is good experience. The architecture here is intricste with distinct exhibition of local culture. There are ample opportunity for photo shoots and it is becoming a spot for pre wedding shoots. If you are tied for time this place can be missed for other attractions in the city.

title: Average place
review: You can visit this place while going to sand dunes. We took guide for this place but he was so disappointed. Read on the internet before you go will be enough.

title: Lot of history in the cenotaphs
review: Hire a guide to show you around the cenotaphs so that you understand a bit about the local history and the royalty who have been cremated there over the centuries. Good for a short visit of less than 30 minutes

title: Magical place
review: We loved this place a lot. We visited the buildings in the late afternoon very close to sunset. It wasn´t very crowded, so it was very lovely to stroll around the area.

title: Awesome place
review: Loved this place. Very crowded place, yet funny activity. Recommend to hire a guide to show case you the haveli so as to learn about it more deeply.

title: BEST CENOTAPHS INDIA
review: If you are ever in Jaisalmer and have an hour [or two] spare take the opportunity to visit the royal cenotaphs at bada [bara] bagh

title: Awesome place for photography
review: This place has so many angles to photograph with lovely architecture to capture. The place has dome and arches together making it perfect to sit ans relax, as it is built on height, the feel of breeze is awesome.

title: Interesting peace of history
review: This historical site is worth to visit for 15 minutes. You will probably enjoy the full of it by ready its history before going on site.

title: Must visit!
review: It's a piece of Jaisalmer's history and must be visited at least once! Such lovely architecture. We opted for a guide who explained the history of the kings and queens whose tombs are made under the chattris! You can watch the sun set on a skyline dotted with windmills!

title: Ok Place... high ticket cost
review: Essentially a set of ruins. we went as a part of sight seeing before safari... very high ticket costs (Rs. 200 per person i think). There is a point before you enter it, from where you can take good snaps. So, you can avoid going in.

title: Nothing much to see
review: Chhatris are found all over Rajasthan, so, if you are short on time, you can give this one a miss. Or, like us, give it a dekko from the outside at sunset time.

title: Visit during sunset for excellent photography
review: Bada Bagh is located 6 kms outside Jaisalmer. You can reach there in an auto in about 10 to 15  mins.Again entry charges are same as Jaisalmer fort and camera is also charged.

title: Nice place to visit
review: The attraction has a lot of histories about the Jaisalmer Royal families . It is a Royal cemetery . Do engage a guide to get the detailed information about this attraction and enjoy the visit , and to get clicked nicely for good still and video recordings .

title: Place of Cenotaphs of Royal Family
review: It's a place where you will find cenotaph of Royal family of Jaisalmer in various shapes and sizes however with very similar architecture. A plate at the centre of each cenotaph describes the person. Made of local yellow stone and too many of them at the same place. Some of them were damaged due to earthquake however most of them are intact. A good view of wind Mills can be seen at a distance. Beautiful ride from city centre to this place.

title: Must Visit Place to Explore
review: This Garden(Bagh) includes a tank and a dam,along with a Govardhan Stambh(Pillar).Bada Bagh is also famous for the Cenotaphs or the monuments that were built by numerous Bhatti rulers.

title: Totally avoidable!
review: At Bada Bagh - there is no Bagh (garden) and it isnt Bada (big), there are a few cenotaphs - nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. All of them are in a total state of ruin, neglect, full of litter.

title: Good for photography.
review: famous for cenotaphs of royal family.

title: Wonderful carvings
review: Worth going on the outskirts of jaisalmer to see this peaceful and beautiful site of cremation of the royal families of jaisalmer...

title: Must visit
review: Nice chatris of Jaisalmer maharajas. It's very near from Jaisalmer. Entry fee is 100 RS per person. Worth going.

title: Interesting but...
review: These Cenotaphs are rather well carved and provide an interesting glimpse of the culture. We were rather aggressively accosted by young men trying to provide guiding services. I think that being a single women at this location might not be prudent.

title: Nice place, if you are nearby it is a sure stop.
review: I believe is the only thing I really liked in Jaisalmer. It stays in the middle of the desert so it give a special scenery to it. It is not a huge place so it won't take you much more than 30 minutes to see it all but if you are already in Jaisalmer it worth going to Bad Bagh.

title: Needs major improvement
review: Baad Bagh a great cultural heritage built by royals of Rajasthan. This place is badly run down and needs attention by the authorities to save it from turning in to complete ruins.

title: Stunning
review: Absolutely beautiful chattris all over the place. A must visit.  Nice view from the top. Do visit enroute to the sand dunes.

title: Good old Monument! Not a Must see.
review: Its just a simple old monument for Kings. Not well maintained. If you are on the way for Sam dune stop for a while!

title: Not value for money
review: This place is little far from city. The ticket cost is very high. There is nothing great at this place. Skip it.

title: Best place to see
review: every thing was good no words to describe, just go and visit jaisalmer, don't forget to take camera with you.

title: quiet place
review: I went there by motorbike with my great guide from the Pol Haveli Hotel in Jaisalmer. I liked the place because it is remote from Jaisalmer and its quiet surrounded by green fields.

title: Exquisite
review: Absolutely stunning during sunset and what made the experience all the more surreal was a traditional singer who had been hired by a family for a small private ceremony. He sang on request and in the open air surrounded by the beautiful structures against the setting sun. While the structures are both eerie and exquisite in their design, the place is quiet and tranquil.

title: crumbling and overpriced
review: Went here for the sunset, the cenotaphs are starting to crumble a bit and there is a definite need for more signage and explanation (other than the guides that tout themselves).  The sunset was pretty but the windmills in the horizon definitely take away from it a little bit.

title: surprisingly beautiful and not with much people
review: it's a deserted place requires a bit of walk, but it's impressive to see the memorial sites of the royal families and there were some interesting signs on each and every memorial stones. Sun set was the best time to visit, you get nice silhouette shots of the structures of these old buildings

title: Historical Memorial
review: An interesting memorial, sadly some is decaying, we went at sunset which was rather nice, would be very hot mid day.  The ground is rocky and rough and could be a problem for elderly visitors.  I enjoyed my visit.

title: A Great Site on decay
review: The cenotaphs of Jaisalmer royals are a great sight to see and frame during sunset.the area is deserted(ruins and arid lanscape) all around. If the no of ppl are few, the site evokes an eerie silence as the sun go down marking the fortune of the kings gone down. But the pricing is ridiculous and outrageous. Dont know where the money finally goes? The zero maintenance and lack of visitor friendly amenities gives hint to a big scam. ASI should immediately take over and save the beautiful structures.

title: Too costly as entry fees in comparison to the facilities
review: Its a good place to see the architecture of the place. There are also good chances of finding few fossils in the place. Sadly the place is not maintained properly. There are no water / washroom facilities in the place but at the entrance there is always a person issuing tickets (@ Rs. 100/- p.p) for Indians.

title: Not worth at all
review: It is too costly to visit. There is not much to see. The only good thing is you don't find much people.

title: Costly
review: Might be good place but so costly to even enter this place for Indians even. Easily Approchable but even you have to pay for Camera phones also

title: Overpriced!
review: The Chattris are beautiful, the place is interesting but poorly managed and overpriced, Rs 100 per person, camera extra!

title: Nice place
review: Bada bagh is a nice place to see we have enjoyed a lot and capture a good pics as memories good place

title: Glowing cenotaphs. Go during sunset.
review: After seeing the Ahar Cenotaphs at Udaipur I still was convinced I wanted to see the Bada Baag cenotaphs at Jaisalmer. So that was what I did first once I reached Jaisalmer.

title: Nice structures
review: Nice small quiet place, lovely views, pretty structures... they have the samadhi of one of their king, lots of sculptures of gods and goddesses, once going is good and it won't take more than 30 minutes there. Good to go and get some pictures clicked.

title: Historic, quite scenic, less crowdy. must visit.
review: Bada bagh which simply means a big garden is located about 15 minutes away from the city, entailing a garden, a dam and a tank. Bada Bagh is also popular for the Cenotaphs or the monuments that were built as a memorial to the royal lineage consisting of numerous Bhatti rulers. It’s a quite scenic and comparatively less crowdy place which shouldn’t take you more than an hour to visit. Rickshaws are easily available for reaching this worth a visit place near Jaisalmer city.

title: Nothing to view
review: I am very much disappointed to see the entrance fees of this place it is 100 Rs each, but the worth of this place is very less. Not recommended

title: Great architecture
review: Tourists can admire this splendid pieces of architecture North of Jaisalmer. Motorbikes or tuk-tuks are available on demand.

title: Nothing special
review: I visited on a morning. It is about 10-15 min tuk tuk ride. The place is a royal memorial to past kings. Nothing special to layman like me. Architecture is normal and commonly seen elsewhere. If you have time to spend, you can visit for an hour (max). Otherwise, you can skip. Not a must-see.

title: Not at all Worth for the entry fee charged
review: Architecturally "Royal Cenotaphs" are really good.

title: Costly affair
review: There is a hefty fee to get entry. You can not go inside before buying the ticket. This place is near Vyas Chhatri.

title: get a guide
review: its simple cenotaph as you see in pics there is not much.but the history with this place is good.so get a guide for 100rs.since we got a guide it was interesting otherwise its simple samadhi.a burial place.good for some photography. a movie location.

title: Stunning, interesting, but definitely in need of attention
review: This was probably one of my younger son's favorite stops in Rajasthan. The cenotaphs of earlier kings, in many states of ruin, provided a lot of opportunity for him to explore and hide while we adults took a closer look. Sadly, not much at all is marked, and you are swarmed immediately by "guides".  The only thing that seems to kept up is the office where they take your cash and check for a camera permit. You can feel he history there, but you don't get as much as you might be wishing for. We climbed around the side of the cenotaphs and gleaned as much as we could. If you go, I would either go as part of a tour with a local guide, or perhaps take a chance on one of the folks there - I almost wish we had.  I would love to see the state pour a little more money and attention to this site.

title: Worth a visit
review: There are many like these, Cenotaph and if you see one place you get to know of all. Great photo opportunities particularly selfies. Good history

title: A must see
review: We really enjoyed our visit to Bada Bagh.  Its only a short distance outside of Jaisalmer and definitely work a visit.  We spent about half an hour walking around looking at the Royal Cenotaphs, its really unique.  The newer ones are much smaller than the older more grand memorials. Watch out for touts coming up to you and starting to tell you about the site... young guys acting all friendly... they are after a fee as a guide.... you don't need a guide here... just read up a bit about it before the visit so you understand the site.

title: Great visit
review: Only 10 min away by tuk tuk (180 r for the tuk tuk to take you there and back + 150r the ticket + 100 rupees if you want to take pictures), this place is amazingly beautiful. It does not take long to see everything and the entrance is a bit expensive (as it is supposed to pay for the renovations which clearly are not made on a regular basis) but it s still worth the visit. one of my favorite place in Jaisalmer !! Highly recommended !

title: Spectacular monuments
review: Beautiful sprawling monuments to the long dead royal lineage. Spread across acres this is a very scenic place with great views for miles around including the windmills.

title: Great little cenotaph doubling up as the royal garden (Bada bagh = Big garden)
review: Bada Bagh is a 15 min drive from Jaisalmer city. The best time to visit is early in the morning when the sun's long rays are directly falling on the beautiful chhatris or dome-shaped pavilion painting them in glorious hue of red. There usually is not much crowd at this place so you can have the place to yourself. Each chhatri has a story to tell and if you try to listen to them with intent you will be able to relate to them easily. Beautiful and solemn - at the same time. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Not much more than what you see in the pics online. Dodgy charges with no tickets issued. ???
review: Stopped off here on a half day drive from Jaisalmer fort where we were staying on our way to a desert camel ride. There is nothing more than the pics you see online but it is on the way so you may as well stop. The many electrical farm wind turbines in the background make a dramatic scene representing the old and new generations.

title: A great place to make pictures
review: Out of the city it offers views but the best time to go is sunset because of the light. Very nice building to photograph. Just pay a little for your ticket and you can walk around where ever you want.

title: Unkept Memorials of the erstwhile kings of Jaisalmer Rajputana
review: If you have spare time, only then visit this place. These are the burial memorials of the erstwhile kings and the structures date back more almost 500-600 years. The place isn't well kept and no information is marked along each place. It is said that during the earthquake in Bhuj, a few structures got damaged with the tremors and no restoration has taken place hence.

title: Great architecture
review: Great architecture..great history... There are many like these, Cenotaph and if you see one place you get to know of all. Great photo opportunities particularly selfies.

title: highly neglected
review: these set of Royal Cenotaphs are amazing in there architecture but after charging a good amount from the tourists they are still neglected. The cenotaphs are broken and the broken pieces instead of being restored.Be aware the supposed entry ticket. An added camera fee applies . Don't pay the camera fee. Just say no camera no photos. No entry tickets or camera tickets are issued. I would even just offer a lesser set amount than what the sign says. This seems to be a cash grab straight in the pockets of the guys at the gate. No paper tickets were given to us. There are no officials onsite, you will be lucky to see anyone there apart from the odd tourist and young Indian guy posing as a student who will offer to guide you all for an end price.

title: Waste of time and money
review: Rs 100 per person + 100 for camera. Guide for 150 - he will explain everything in 5-7 minutes and disappear. Better read up on history if you decide to go. Guide is a waste of money.

title: Cenotaphs with great view
review: Good architecture but no restoration of the monument. It contains a set of royal cenotaphs, or chatrris of Maharajas of Jaisalmer.

title: Not at all recommended, I would give zero if I could
review: They take fees for visiting the bada bagh (which actually is a burial groud) on the name of maintenance. Which is a big shock when you visit the place, that's the time you feel that you have been cheated. And above all there are guide there to rob you further of your money in the name of service.

title: Nice centopahs.
review: 1.  Entry fee is there. Place is good for photo memories.

title: Good place to visit with official Guide as historic place
review: First of all take services of official Guide as this is very informative and historic place. One of the attractive places in Jaisalmer to visit. The architecture and the nature is beautiful, if you are planning to visit Jaisalmer then make sure this place should be included in your plan.We really liked this wonderful place.Nice place with less people around and the rough terrain give best opportunity for clicking some memorable photos. It is a cremation ground of the Royal family but also place importance for the people of Jaisalmer. This is the only place in Jaisalmer where you find the fruit trees. The windmills in the backdrop gives a feeling of the marriage of history with the science.

title: Could have been a big tourist attraction of Jaisalmer.
review: The Bada Bagh is basically a royal cenotaphs or chattris on the outskirts of Jaisalmer. They were built by the Jaisalmer royal family as memorials for their Kings and Queens.  Like a lot of  heritage sites in India, the Bada Bagh now sits in ruins. They do take a ton of money as entrance and camera fees but it seemed that none of the money was going towards the maintenance of Bada Bagh. Neither the Jaisalmer royal family or the city of Jaisalmer seemed to care about its current state. I did find some guides near the Bada Bagh premises but I didn’t bother taking their services. The current state of Bada Bagh seemed depressing to say the least. There was litter everywhere, from mineral water to beer bottles, there was garbage strewn everywhere. This showed the bureaucracy in India and how the people just did not care about the historical sites of our country. I am sure they have the funds are they charge at least INR 200 to INR 300 from every person who visits Bada Bagh, they just lack the desire to contribute towards the development. Jaisalmer still has a lot of catching up to do when it comes fro tourism.

title: Great History.Great Architecture.
review: Great History.Wonderful Architecture.The place has a very calm and etheral charm.A must visit. A part of movies

title: Beautifull cenotaphs
review: Those are the royal cenotaphs of Jaisalmer, located a few kilometers away from the city, you can easily visit then as a stop in the tour to the Dunes.

title: over-rated and over hyped
review: there isnt much to do there or look for.. some of the sunset views are good  the structure with setting sun in the backdrop gives a couple of good clicks.. but nothing much beyond that

title: Another history!!!
review: This place has a history and I'm not here to educate about it.. well it's a good place to chill and know about the cemeteries of the queens and kings that got their cremation here and also yea take good pictures...

title: Visit while coming back from Sam Sand dunes
review: The place has memorial 'Chatris' for the Rajasthani Kings / noble persons. Structure and constructions is not very elaborate. Place is badly managed and structure is crumbling at a lot of places. They charge 100 rupees as a entry free per person and another 100 to use mobile phone, which I suspect don't even go to the right place.

title: Majestic
review: Bada bagh lies 7kms from the town of Jaisalmer and far away from the bustle of the town. It is a wonderful place to be, earlier in the day or late evenings (Before sunset) and one could soak in solitude. Although not very well maintained, the chhatris are reminiscence of a bygone era and provides a taste of history to the discerning tourist. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the town.

title: Beauty in desert
review: Bada bagh - located outside of Jaisalmer - are one of the most beautiful cenotaphs of the city.Its really beautiful to go there in late evenings or early morning. Had a great view. The structures are very good

title: Big Garden
review: Bada Bagh means big garden. Enjoyed going here but some of the buildings were beginning to crumble, which is sad. But still a great place to visit. We combined it with a trip to the desert.

title: Private property, 150rs per person entry
review: For all the money they take as entrance fee, there's not  a single description or inscription anywhere inside, just a set of broken down chattris. Not worth the trip out

title: A curious "garden"  just outside of Jaisalmer ...
review: "Bada Bagh" or "Barabagh" is located about 6km North of Jaisalmer and is one of its most visited tourist attractions. Literally, "Bada Bagh" means "Big Garden", what could be true back in the 18th century, when the first royal cenotaphs were built. But you won't see any garden, flowers or ponds on its main area. As a matter of fact, it does look much more like a memorial cemetery. But, the beautiful yellow sandstone cenotaphs - called "chhatris" - are empty tombs, honoring the Maharawals of Jaisalmer, their wives, other royal family members and war heroes - and were built while they were alive and in good spirits. This tradition was discontinued not very long ago, in 1947, when, according to a local legend, a prince died of a mysterious disease while his "chhatris" was being built. This was considered as a very bad omen leading to the end of this 200 year old tradition. Amazing legends of the "Golden City" of Jaisalmer ... A small fee is charged to all visitors, no facilities are seen on the premisses (it means, bring your own water and snacks) and visiting "Bada Bagh" after sunset is at your own risk. A professional guide is highly recommended. Enjoy!

title: Royal cenotaphs
review: This place holds the cenotaphs of the past emperors with carved umbrellas. The architecture is a nice to see but unless you are a Rajasthani history buff, skip this place.

title: Beautiful and quaint little spot - best for sunset!
review: Great little spot for sunset - guess why it's called sunset point also! Great view of the fort - we took some lovely photos there.

title: Trashed National heritage
review: An amazing site of religious and historical significance but given very little respect by the locals. Broken beer bottles, seemingly hundreds of them, litter the site. Rubbish is strewn everywhere. The monuments have been allowed to fall into disrepair with little or no effort made to restore them. Very sad treatment of something of which Indians generally and Rajasthanis, Jaisalmerians in particular, should feel very proud.

title: great place
review: I am surprised to see this beautiful and excellent piece of art is left as it is without any proper management or taking care. The design and the architecture is absolutely great.

title: why to visit
review: entrance fee is not worth , there's not a single description or inscription anywhere inside, just a set of broken down chattris.

title: Interesting
review: This is located about 30 mins outside of the city so you can hire a scooter or take an auto rickshaw. nice location and great for photos, especially around sunset.

title: Superb architecture
review: A must visit place if you are fond of architecture. Basically the place is not as per the name there are lot of "chatris" which are symbol of royal family's member. After their death one chatri is added here. But the chatris are so beautiful nd technically made to be saved in earthquake.

title: very beautiful spot just like a flim set
review: Its really beautiful to go there in late evenings or early morning. Had a great view. The structures are very good

title: Amazing amazing
review: Wooo!!!!what I can say about this place. Beautiful architecture all around. You will love this place for sure. the near by wind power stations add a different perspective of old and new at same place. I saw many artist with there drawings.

title: Very nice place
review: If you are there you feel like in the movie Aladdin. Specially by sunset it reveals his beauty.

title: A nice place for history buffs and architecture lovers!
review: This place is home to the cenotaphs erected in the memory of erstwhile rulers of Jaisalmer and their wives. Architecture of the cenotaphs is varied as we start to see the Mughal influence on the relatively newer ones, with domes in place as opposed to the older ones.

title: Good for photos
review: Ok watch out for the charges not worth the photos. Watch out for too many young unsavory characters. After dark avoid unless you are a group with 5-6 males able bodies. Too many unsavory looking drinking and smoking youths

title: Beautiful place
review: It is about 6-7 kms from Jaisalmer city. I went on a rented bike. Good roads.

title: You can but not a must-visit place !
review: Don't have anything to do ? then you can go to this place. Typically for people who are interested in visiting historical places.

title: Beautiful cenotaphs
review: Bada bagh - located outside of Jaisalmer - are one of the most beautiful cenotaphs of the city. The cluster of cenotaphs, with hilly backdrops, and located amidst farms are visible from a distance itself. The architecture is beautiful and calls for clicking some really amazing pics. At the end cenotaph, you can view the sprawling green farms and the towering windmills. The area is not maintained well (stairs broken) - so you need to be careful and not be overly enthusiastic.

title: Quick tick off the list
review: We visited this place in afternoon enroute sanddunes, which was not a great time. Best to be visited at sunset or when weather is pleasant.

title: deserted nice architecture
review: I did not see too many visitors at this location. But its really a photogenic place. People who love architectural photography will love it

title: Amazing
review: Amazing Bada Bagh Jaisalmer. This place is Royal Cenotaph called Chhatries at Jaisalmer is an attraction to the tourists and visited by domestic and international tourists. The History of Bada Bagh is very charming and Chhatries are beautiful.

title: Coolest cemetery ever
review: The architecture in this cemetery is impressive. A treasure a few kms away from Jaisalmer.  Usually a rickshaw driver can take you there. Recommended.

title: Nice place
