review: This is very beautiful picturistic place almost outside the jaislmer city. But there is a lot of hidden history behind this place. the guides who tends to make you feel that he knows everyhting about this place actually lies a lot. My friend had read the history before we visited the place and found out that the guide made some story of his own about the place. so read in advance about the place you are about to visit.

title: Exploitation of tourists seeking to enjoy Sun Set
review: Sun set in Jaisalmer is a feast to eyes. We were charged quite heavily to enter this place to enjoy the sunset, as it happens to be in an elevated place.

title: Nothing special
review: They are now charging IR100 to enter & another IR100 to take pictures. It is in a bad state repair and needs a lot of TLC. It hasn't the energy of other cenotaphs. The terrain is rocky so wear sturdy shoes

title: Considering skipping it
review: This place is better in pictures, just a memorial and the architecture isn't too fascinating to be honest. Rather cover the havelis , palace, village and desert.

title: Serene and peaceful
review: Well maintained, serene and peaceful, a visit to this site really gives one a feel of the culture and grandeur of the royals lifestyles.

title: Definitely a highlight!
review: These cenotaphs mark the cremation sites of the local royalty. There was no one else when we visited, which gave it a great atmosphere. Beautiful place (probably more so after the rains).

title: Lonely Place with a great view
review: Entry is paid.

title: Serene place; grand cenotaphs
review: This place is serene. There are many cenotaphs of the royal family. There is obviously some history for these cenotaphs; but that was outside our area of interest. The architecture is grand. We visited during sunset and it was pleasant.

title: "Best sunset"
review: I went there for sunset with an Indian friend on his bike. It was such a wonderful place. Watching sunset through the cenatops is very nice. There is a maharaja garden as well.

title: Not a convincing place
review: this is a burial place for all the past rulers of jaisalmer. can be missed. the ticket for this place is expensive

title: Not a must
review: You won't miss anything if you don't go there. These are the memorials of old kings but don't contain anything historical as such. Poorly maintained and stray dogs all around, you end up frustrated there. It's not worth the fees they charge. You can easily avoid this place. There would be a couple of guides there but it's not worth paying even a penny.

title: Place for relaxing
review: For me Bada Bagh  is the place to meet antiquity and feel relax, especially if weather is cool. 2 times I visited this majestic place and both times I was lucky about weather. It's really let you enjoy of architecture and view.

title: average DO NOT GIVE MORE THAN RS 100 GUIDE
review: Average. Do not give more than Rs 100 to guide.

title: Better to see this with a guide
review: It's better to visit with a guide so that you may learn some history about the cenotaphs and who is buried here.

title: Nice
review: Bada Bagh cynotapes is something different ,lovely place must visit in Jaisalmer. Best season for visit is during winter and spring not summer

title: Fasinating
review: Very interesting place and gives in insight into how the Indian culture has a different approach to celebrating and memorialising the dead.

title: Scenic view
review: Bada Bagh is a good example of architecture. Here you will some people offer alcohol to god. It just outside the city 4 or 5 KM.

title: Memorial of Royalty
review: This place is a memorial for royal family. If you don't have a guide to tell you the story, it is just like any other monument. No govt approved guides in this place. Only some local kids working for money. They do share the stories surrounding the place.

title: great place for photos
review: Beautiful place here. Was nice walking around and trying to get the best photos we could. However being two female white tourist we spent alot of the time being photographed by other people and having to get photos with people which was very annoying.

title: Beautiful Cenotaphs..
review: Atop a hill just minutes away from the desert city of Jaisalmer, travelers will find the eerily calm setting of Bada Bada Bagh or Big Garden. Wind whips through crumbling cenotaphs, made of the famous golden stone of Jaisalmer, built in memory of the city’s rulers. Giant wind turbines hum in background. Beautiful creation if you have interest in such places.

title: Ok place
review: This place may interest those people who haven't seen Cenotaphs earlier.

title: Thought provoking place, just ignore the tour touts
review: It is interesting how architecture is used to remember the dead, but this is in true Rajasthani style the architecture is stunning yet eerie at the same time.

title: Collection of empty tombs.
review: This is a place outside Jaisalmer on the road towards Tanot. It looks good from far, But paying to enter an unclean place is not a great idea.

title: Quite good
review: If you like cenotaphs, then you should visit this place....I visited it during afternoon due to time constraint. But I hace heard that this is best viewed during evenings....

title: Memorial
review: This is in memory of the Queens who committed sati. A must visit while on way to Pakistan border but avoid the locals and people loafing around.

title: royals cemetorium
review: Its a garden complex which is about 6 km from Jaisalmer city. It consists sets of royal cenotaphs of the Maharajas. All the royal family members were cremated there, There  is entry fee for foreigners and for Indians.  There are also camera charges as well, The architecture is really beautiful and  are made of yellow sandstones. I did not see any lake , but one can visit if you have time but its not a must visit,

title: Amazing architecture - A MUST
review: So NOT miss this location. Bring camera. Best time is sunset but unfortunately the strange shapes of the cenotaphs are facing the wrong way for the setting sun!

title: Good place but not well maintaned
review: Its a good place but not well maintained. This place is under royal family of jaisalmer but unluckily they people are not taking care of this place.

title: Very bad nothing special
review: Nothing special for scene  no maintain no any Sevice ticket require waste of time for from  city only chatri built and every where charge ticket for entry

title: Mausoleums in the desert
review: Fascinating if this is your thing.  You are pestered non-stop by "guides" or "salesmen" which can really ruin the atmosphere.

title: Burial ground- fantasy name Bada Bagh
review: Nothing much great, Guide is must to understand its history & importance. You can differentiate the hindu architecture & mughals architecture.

title: Won't consider it a must-visit place
review: Although the architecture of the domes is something not to miss for the one's looking for something like that. For me it was just another place with  view of wind turbines and the great thar desert.

title: Worth a visit
review: This place is good for taking some photos. Worth for spending half an our. Not well maintained, ticketing staffs are corrupt, they will permit entry without issuing tickets.

title: Nice place to see sunset!
review: We went there for sunset and it was very scenic! Entrance fee is 50 or 100 Rs, fee for camera separate as usual...But still it is nice place, despite of garbage and too much tourists on sunset.

title: Pretty and pretty dirty
review: Complex of memorials for dead royalty and their families.  Pretty, but poorly maintained and like everywhere else in India, strewn with waste. You are required to take off you shoes, but garbage and graffiti are OK. If you really respect your dead, keep it clean!!

title: In the middle of Windmills.
review: The place looks great from the approach road and would give away beautiful pictures if you have a good camera that i didn't have.

title: Super
review: Bada bagh is super historic sentop you can see nice sun set from there there is old gardens  if you are enterested about  history you here to go there

title: A Lonely Place
review: Rode out to the site on a rented motorcycle. A small entry fee is collected at the gate. A very unusual place to visit.A little difficult to find because the town has the same name.

title: Intricately carved royal cenotaphs short distance out of town
review: Many films have been shot here. There are more than 100 cenotaphs -places where ashes of the dearly departed Kings have been preserved under 'chhatris' or tombs. Contrary to what this may sound like, it is a beautiful garden. You have to see the sheer beauty and magnitude of the structures to believe it.

title: The Cenotaphs of the kings of Jaisalmer
review: A wonderful piece of history lives here in the form of the cenotaphs of the past kings of Jaisalmer. There is a supposed lake around it , we did not see this as we had gone at the peak of summer. But the cenotaphs themselves are beautifully carved and well worth a visit for people who love architecture

title: Let them Rest in Peace
review: Visited Bada Bagh on our way back to Jaisalmer from Tanot Temple couple of Km before the city. Overall this is a nice place to see and actually this is a Cremation ground of the royal family of Jaisalmer.This is a very nice place for photographers to capture pics around win mills. We need to respect the place.

title: Cenotaphs
review: This site contains a series of cenotaphs for the royals that ruled Jaisalmer.

title: Interesting place to visit
review: We visited in January 2016.

title: Avoid if u can
review: Most lousy tourists spot in Jaisalmer not a worth they have a entrance ticket of Rs 50 abd Camera Ticket Rs 100

title: Nothing Much here to see
review: I don't found this place very interesting. Normal place. The place is meant for the graves of the Kings and his family.

title: Beautiful architecture with sunset view
review: Come here when the sun sets. An hour will be good enough to enjoy the sunset after looking around.  20 minutes drive by Tuk Tuk from fort area where we stayed. You will need to book the Tuk Tuk for return as well because it's rural. A small fee of 150rp for guide.

title: Nice location
review: Nice place to visit, slightly away from city. Lots of amazing stories about it. (Do not follow google maps, location is wrong on it).

title: Interesting... worth the visit!
review: Very unique place particularly in the parlance of Hindu customs and traditions.... Found the concept of cenotaphs very interesting. The story behind the place is also quite unique... Do pay a visit if  you are in Jaisalmer.

title: kings place of sleeping
review: It is the place where kings buried after their death. Here so many architectural little "chatri" temple type structure build for each and every king of the jaisalmer.

title: nice little ruins outside of the city
review: located about 6km outside of Jaisalmer, this is a cenotaph ruins site from Maharajas dating back to around the 1800s i think, it is worth a visit if you are looking to fill a few hours, it is not far and entrance is approx 100 rupees.

title: Nice Architechure
review: Visited Bada Bagh on my way back to Jaisalmer from Tanot, there is a single board pointing towards this place, there is a entry fee to visit this place. Overall this is a nice place to see and actually this is a Cremation ground of the royal family of Jaisalmer.This is a very nice place for photographers to capture pics during sunset.

title: Cenotaphs
review: Nice place to visit.It is the place where King buried after their death.Get a guide who can explain the history.Do not follow google map location is wrong on it.

title: Watch out for the smooth operators
review: As soon as we arrived here,  the local lads were buzzing round trying to sell us maps,  offer their services as a tour guide and relieve you of your home currency.   There seemed to be a bit of a turf war but all in good humour.

title: A Film Setting kind view
review: A little away from City of Jaisalmer is Bada Bagh which is interesting to see many umbrella structures constructed in the color of sand.  A great place to spend time to take pictures.

title: Quaint & scenic
review: Bada Bagh is a garden complex. It contains the set of royal set of cenotaphs or chattris of Maharajas. The view is amazing, also provides a great background for clicking pictures for photo lovers. Newly married couples also come in for photography.

title: Bada Bagh - royal cenotaphs for immortality
review: Bada Bagh, located about 6km from Jaiselmer is surrounding by dense trees & orchards but in the midst of it are the royal cenotaphs & cremation ground for the Rajputs.  The cenotaphs located on a slight hillock will give the appearance of dinosaur scales on the back of a giant animal, floating on parched golden sand.  A very picturesque setting with plenty of photo opportunities among the cenotaphs but be forewarned that your pictures could have a negative capture with the giant windmills around the area.

title: nice place
review: its a nice place. one shld visit once to this place if u r in jaisalmer. many movies shooting is been done here. so once u she u will remember.

title: Royal cenotaphs
review: Royal cenotaphs... beautifully carved...you can enjoy sunset there..near jaisalmer city on tanot mata road

title: Go there to kill time
review: It is nearly 6 kms away from centre of Jaisalmer. We went there simply because we had lot of time and nothing else to do. If I would have planned better, I would have either gone to Khuri or Tanot Mata.

title: Nice view
review: these cynotophes look attractive. but since there is nothing much to see, just a photo stop. Dont waste your time coming all out here. you can see them from distant...

title: bada bagh or the big garden is a rajputana architectural treat
review: this place happens to be the crematorium ground of the kings and queens. has a great rajputana architectural touch in its creation

title: Bada Bagh
review: The place is not at all maintained. Though the place is near the city however very few people visit the place as compared to the fort and desert.

title: I didn't see any bagh
review: This place is okay. I don't think there should be a fees to enter it. But its a place to be visited by families and thats all.

title: Cenotaphs
review: Interesting sight, but made far more so by an informed local guide, to understand the history and background.

title: Take time out to visit
review: Is a little out of Jaisalmer and not usually on the taxi driver's list of sites to visit. Take time out to visit. Is beautiful though not in good condition and slowly coming apart. Pay a nominal entry fee. Guides are available, bargain for a good price and hear stories from them. Worth the visit, rulers of Jaisalmer rest here so is historic and sacred place. Watch marriage parties arrive here for the newly weds to get blessed by thei past kings

title: Bada bagh splendid view
review: Must visit place .rustic look of cenotaph and clear blue sky gives a mesmerising view .the architecture  is very detailed  . It's diffrent from the Jaisalmer fort and very quiet . You get a view of the wind turbines too. If you are interested in the history do hire a guide .

title: Nearby Jaisalmer
review: Visited this place last week on the way to Sam sand dunes desert camp from Jaislamer. This place is basically royal cenotaphs. You can hire a guide to know little bit of history behind or just go around by yourself (will not take much time). Also can click some nice pictures of the beautiful architecture.

title: Ok ok place
review: There is nothing much about this place, basically it's a graveyard of the royal family of jaisalmer. Particularly its a place where ashes of kings are kept in a pot. It's surrounded by wind mills. It's beautiful to view. They make lot of money by visitors. Please do not pay for taking camera, as you can skip this by a tip.

title: nice visit
review: a master piece of different kind of architectural chhataris...ancient and traditional...spend some time here

title: Very Nice
review: It is full of small and big memorials of kings and their families all in one colour -light pink. There is a garden attached to it. We went there in the evening and seeing the sunset from there was a pleasant experience.

title: Beautiful
review: We loved the beautiful architecture and serenity offered by the place. They are cenotaphs of the royal family and the intricate work on them depicts the grandeur. Lovely place to capture picture memoirs with the family and friends.

title: Centops of Royal Family...
review: Bada Bagh, also called Barabagh (literally Big Garden) is a garden complex about 6 km north of Jaisalmer on way to Ramgarh, and halfway between Jaisalmer and Lodhruva in the state of Rajasthan in India. It contains a set of royal cenotaphs, or chhatris of Maharajas of Jaisalmer state, starting withJai Singh.

title: A nice (albeit simple) spot for sunset
review: Not a ton to see, but it was a nice place to stop for sunset.  A nice grouping of small buildings with an interesting mixture of architectural and desing influences.

title: Pretty and interesting history
review: This place provides a lovely view of the sunset.it looks beautiful.best to hire a guide who will help you understand the history of the place.nice visit.

title: A good place to click pictures !
review: This place one can visit on the way to sam dessert , Its basiclly a good place to take picture with family .

title: Nothing great to watch!
review: Cenotaphs are there. But not worth of money & visit. Kindly don't waste time to watch this. Plan other places.

title: Nice Bagh
review: Bada Bagh is little bit far from Jaisalmer city or Golden Fort. It is 7-8 Kms from Golden Fort. If you have time, you can visit.

title: Amazing Cenotaphs surrounded by Windmills all around
review: There are about 100 cenotaphs( chattris) built here at different times with intricate architecture. It has a nice history to it, which the guides present there share. It gives an ariel view of the Jaisalmer city as well.

title: Wished to lost in yellow nature all around
review: It's peaceful  place in outskirts. Still if you are nature or history lover you can't miss this place. There are about 100 cenotaphs ( Chatrris). built during the different dynasties  of Jaisalmer.

title: Exceptional
review: I loved walking around the complex at sunset. Such an amazing contrast with all the wind turbines scattered in the distance.

title: Nice Place to visit
review: the place is on the way to sand dunes near to city Jaisalmer, and monuments are just look like umbrellas.

title: Wonderful
review: Its really great visit at most beautiful semetry its unbelievable stone carving an search nice an quiet place to relax near by town an nice garden there an you should stay for there for sunset its very good an we take there local guide an his explaining about history of Maharaja or guide raju is very good to explain about history

title: Good architecture
review: Visit the bada bagh if you are interested to see the ancient rajasthani architecture. The place is quiet . To know more about this place you may hire a guide here. Good location for photographers loving to shoot architecture.

title: Good place
review: Place is beautiful and view is awsome. Different from any other fort or place in jaisalmer. Its very bear by the jaisalmer city hardly5-7 kms. Must go and experiece.

title: Beautiful old structures forgotten by the govenment
review: Must see place in Jaisalmer...lovely chatris of the Jaisalmer kings, a photographer delight.

title: Memorials
review: This place has a lot of memorials for kings and queens. The view from here is calming. You could visit here on the way to a desert camp.

title: Visit at sunset
review: A beautiful atmospheric place in the desert, if you have a chance you should definitely see this  at sunset, great photos, goats and children are an added bonus!

title: A place which should be protected
review: A very nice architecture in bad shape

title: Beautiful during sunset but abandoned in terms of maintainence
review: The Place is looks more beautiful if you can manage it during sunset. Don't carry high expectations while visiting as you might feel disappointed to see the poor maintenance. teh place has historical chhatries which depicts the  cremation place of kings and their queens who carried forward the old Sati pratha. The place will surely add to your picture collections with the beautiful sunset behind and little history atatched.

title: Bada Bagh
review: I visited Bada Bagh on the 29 NOV 14 - on the way to start my Thar Desert Safari. It was a unique experience, guides are available for a reasonable amount.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Awesome place, guys it contains royal cenotaphs. which is famous for its architecture. lot of songs filmed here. nearby a garden and pond is also good place to visit.

title: Just a Heritage Tourist Spot...
review: We were not very much excited to visit this place in a bright sunny afternoon until we got to know that a shooting of bollywood movie with renowned star cast was on there.

title: Amazing architecture dedicated to deceased royals
review: This place is amazing, it just appears on a hillside and contains a set of royal cenotaphs ( "empty tomb" or a monument erected in honour of a person or group of people whose remains are elsewhere.  The chhatris( elevated, dome-shaped pavilions used as an element in Indian architecture) of Maharajas of Jaisalmer state, starting with Jai Singh II (d. 1743)

title: Stunning in the late afternoon sun
review: This place is built from that lovely golden stone that is found around Jaisalmer. Stunning in the afternoon sun. Well worth a visit.

title: Architectural Marvel.
review: Jaisalmer's BadaBagh was created by Maharaja Jai Singh II in order to have a lush green garden in the middle of a barren land of Jaisalmer. BadaBagh also has several cenotaphs for the royal family. Though the cenotaphs are just a part of BadaBagh, they have now become the only point of attraction at this place, as the gardens due to the lack of maintenance have left with random trees and bushes that no more attractive to say the least.

title: Silence and peace !
review: Make yourselves free for an hour, go there, just sit down on one of those 'chatris' gazing at the lake near by ! Totally Refreshing !!

title: Should have been beautiful but it sucked.
review: Should have been a beautiful site but soured by the guard stopping us to pay 100 each, no prob, except then we watched a couple guys also on a bike fly right in. He explained that they are locals and so are free... What? Not what the sign says. Whatever. It's India.

title: average attraction
review: nice architecture, lots of chatris, a bit of history, cenotaphs, nothing great, not at all well maintained

title: Garden of Kings
review: Place where the Kings use to do there gardening & grow the greenery for there enjoyment with a pound surrounded.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Its a beautiful cenotaph of the royal family and they build it on demise of every king. Its also a famous film shooting location for various movies.

title: Dilpidated structure
review: The Chhatris which depict the cremation places of various royals and their queens: some even depicting the places where queens performed Sati (Burning in the pyre of the husband), are not well maintained. There are no qualified guides to explain the  history and the plaques are in an unknown language which can not be understood by the tourists.

title: Looks like higjly abandoned place
review: Not too far from city but quiet loking abandoned place , attractive though. Feels like no one including Rajasthan government or Archeological department has intetest in preserving  these monuments. Many in broken shape, no care taker, any body could go and ruin monument easily. Feel upset visiting this monument. Foreigner would definitely would not appreciate it in present state.

title: It is not maintained. Realize that it is only a Cenotaph. There is nothing else. Nothing great to see.
review: It is not worth wasting one's time. It is nothing but burial ground of the Kings with Cenotaphs( Chhatries) made in their memory.

title: A must see mausoleum
review: We had  a detour planned so we could see this location.  Is not that far from Jaisalmer yet people seem to miss this. Worth the visit, a plethora of rock constructions, tombs. Worth the check in and you should take some amazing photos.

title: Sad but very important Historical Place!
review: This is where all the "Chatris" are of kings who has died and their queens who have died behind them ("Sati") or died by natural causes. One of the most important places to visit when you are in Jaisalmer.

title: CREMOTORIUM
review: This structure is on highway, built by King Jai Singh II in 1743 AD, must visit once.  If you have your own vehicle, you can make a round trip of Jain Temples and other Monuments, surrounding Jaisalmer.

title: A must visit place if you are in jaisalmer
review: Bada bagh is the place we like most in our jaisalmer trip.

title: OUTSIDE OF JAISALMER, JUST 5/6 KM.
review: From the view of the Maharaja's History reveals.

title: Best views of rajasthani roads and windmills
review: Visit this place by taking rented bikes frm city. Best views standing on top of place with windmills around and beautiful architecture.

title: an interesting stop on the way out of town
review: If you're interested in burial sites, don't miss this one.  There are guides here, which, in my opinion, can be skipped.  simply wander the site and read about it online or in your travel book.

title: Very good
review: This is a beautiful large garden .so many chatris in this garden . I visited this place in the evening.stunning sun view here.

title: Place need more attention from government
review: This place has a great history and it's beautiful too but it is lacking of knowledge and information . If you go there without searching on Internet the history you will not understand the purpose of the place and how important it is .

title: It's History
review: The place is little far from jmain city. It got quite interesting history. So, the tradition of our india passed from one one son to another

title: A nice visit for an hour
review: Bada bagh is a place we have seen in many movies before. This is mainly the cenotaph of the royal family. This place is still private and maintained by the royal family.

title: funny place
review: the kids selling their fossils are very funny.

title: worth a visit
review: if you enjoy taking picture of interesting architecture, go there. It doesn't take long to have a look at it but it is worth seeing.

title: Ancientness
review: It's a great place to visit with your kids ... Architecture and location is awesome ... The location is poorly maintained which I really disliked

title: Good place
review: the time i went there was no body .. You can get some nice clicks here .. You cant spend more than 30 mins here .

title: Nothing Great
review: Burial Monuments of the kings from the state. you need to pay for tickets to visit this place. no lights, no arrangement, a very deserted burial place.

title: Beautiful place
review: An excellent place to drive and relax. 16 kms from Jaisalmer you need a vehicle to reach this place. You can see the age old CHATRIS of the queens there and the artificial lake created

title: Beautiful Place
review: Must visit this sight during the evening. DO NOT GO WITHOUT A GUIDE. The history of this place is amazing, and super interesting.

title: Peaceful
review: Bada Bagh, about 6kms north of Jaisalmer, remains the best escape from the bustle of the city. With the two-hundred years old royal cenotaphs overlooking the rolling sandy hills, this place is ideal for a couple of tranquil hours during sunset. However, do note that even though the name means 'big garden' - the garden is no more.

title: Very nice architecture
review: We made a quick visit here and it was worth the short drive out of the city.  It's pretty unmaintained and a good place to get some great photos, good atmosphere too.

title: Beautiful at sunset
review: This group of royal cenotaphs is a popular place to watch the sunset. A bit surreal, being surrounded by wind farms makes it even more interesting.

title: Excellent Cenotaphs
review: The cenotaphs here are really great, they appear amazing from a distance, perched on a slight hill slope, this place offers good views of the sunset from here.

title: They say it as a cenetop
review: 6 km from the jaisalmer

title: Amazing
review: I love this place photographs i.have taken.are amazing and beautiful

title: Intricate Chatris or Centolaphs
review: Enroute to Sam desert camps.. Once upon a time, a big garden was created with exotic fruits. Hence the name Bada Bagh.. Later on, the chatris or ornate umbrellas carved in sand stone were erected over the dead royal families.. Looks beautiful from a distance.

title: Avoidable
review: To me, it was a waste of time. There is history in the Cenotaphs but, history should interest you to enjoy the place. It is generally thrown in as a part of the package but then, it costs time. No point reaching there and wondering - WHAT DO I DO HERE? The guides are irritating too.

title: local jaisalmer tour
review: Wonderful experience in my life.  I wish, would be there again to recapitulation my memory.  Golden fort is excellent and desert tour is mind blowing

title: The magnificent chatris
review: The chatris are known to be built by the grandsons after they get married in the memory of their grand father. Little complex to read? So, lets keep it simple..the chatris are series of tomb like structures built in the memory of ancestors. The series of these structures are simply awesome. I loved the beauty of this place and the calm surrounding was adding to the beauty.

title: picture perfect place
review: Got the chance to be there and loved the views the canopies and the heritage history of that place there is also a temple back side quiet interesting to know about its traditional importance  we'll I m so much in love with jaisalmer and all the places I have seen

title: Good for Shutterbugs
review: It is basically a cremation ground for the Royals where the Grandsons construct a Cenotaph or Chattri for their Grandfathers and hence goes the culture.

title: Bada Bagh, Jaisalmer
review: The Bada Bagh at Jaisalmer (Rajasthan, India), meaning a large garden is very popular as the shooting location of the famous wedding scene in the Bollywood film, Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam. Situated about 5-10 kms away from the Jaisalmer city and built about 300 years ago, it contains Cenotaphs or Chhatris of the erstwhile kings of Jaisalmer, Though not maintained properly, the beauty of the place especially keeping in mind the dried up lake/river bed next to it and the cool breeze blowing through the intricately carved pillared columns makes it a must visit destination. The views of numerous Windmills around it is simply fascinating.

title: Not worth the visit
review: While the attraction is supposed to be Bada Bagh (Big Garden), we can have a close look at this garden.  Instead we can see the cenotaph of the Royals. there are a bunch of them there.

title: On the way to dearest.( halfway between Jaisalmer and Lodhruva )
review: Best place for photography.if you can plan it In the morning or the sunset time it will be great .

title: Hidden gem
review: We decided to go last minute, right before we left Jaisalmer. It is off the beaten track and about 20 minutes outside of the town. It is very serene. I recommend going with someone who knows the history of it. There is very little shade so go in the morning! There is also a garden below the cenotaphs that is very lush and green--lots of fruit trees used to provide the locals with fresh produce.

title: Royal Cenotaphs
review: Place is between old and new jaislmer, These chattries were made in honor of the royal families. Its beautiful place to visit and watch sunset.

title: Nice place but poor maintanence
review: This is the royal burial ground and is located about 5 kms from the city. The entry fee is 100 per person but absolutely no maintenance as you can see loads of broken alcohol bottles all around.The tombs looks very nice and it's a great place for some  pictures,nothing more!

title: Where Royalty Sleeps for eternity..
review: It was among 3 sightseeing spots between Jaisalmer city and dunes.

title: Beutiful place and history linked to it
review: Its a place of cremation of the royal family and this place is very popular for shooting in bollywood movies.

title: Canopies over the Grave Yards
review: "Chhatries" or the Canopies built over Grave Yards is a very common site in whole of Rajasthan. However they look beautiful and that's how they have become a tourist attraction. Best part of these places is that they provide shade and you feel comfortable sitting under the shades of these canopies. We noticed stones on each grave with male and female figures. These figures typically depicted as to how many wives that male had.

title: Old history up close
review: The Centotaphs are really cool to see. The area itself isn't well-maintained, and there are people just hanging around and some garbage, but it's relatively well-cared for, and they are beautiful ancient structures to look at.

title: Where does the money go?
review: Beautiful cenotaphs. I'm disappointed by the high costs with little or no maintenance. I've been many times, and I often pay the 100 rupees cost for entrance  with a camera. Many times the man collecting the money only gives me a receipt for 50 rupees. I suspect he is keeping the difference. Unfortunately, the area is full of litter and there is no repairs on the damaged cenotaphs.

title: Amazing
review: We loved this site since it is placed close to a very beautiful lake and you can walk around and have a look at these monuments in an stunning environment. We recommend to do this either early morning or late evening as it can be quite hot during the day.

title: Bada Bagh is attractive
review: The Place is not been taken care so pretty dirty with a lot of Beer Bottles around and chips wrappers which makes the beauty looks dirty

title: Some type of royal kabristaan
review: This place is again good for photos .......when people die one similar structure made for him.....again historical touch

title: Outside Jaisalmer but worth the trek
review: Quite a long trek outside Jaisalmer, this is a lonely spot that I found quite interesting. A rickshaw will take you there and back for around Rs100 if you drive a hard bargain, but despite what all the guide books tell you, there's a Rs200 fee to enter the grounds AND a camera fee. Since the place is completely isolated with no staff or guides at all, I'm not sure you need to bother declaring your camera. It's a stark, silent place, surrounded by desert, but I found the crumbling mausoleums in amongst the newer additions all quite magical.

title: A Frame of Bollywood
review: This place will definitely make you (Indians) feel that I have seen it some were… Because it was many times part of many Bollywood and other Indian cinemas.

title: Beautiful Place
review: Beautiful place. Alternate place to the desert sunset. Although we couldnt see the sun set there, we could imagine that this place will be very beautiful in the evening light

title: Nice for a short visit
review: Very nice olace, even better during the sunset. It's nice for a short visit not more. riksha guys will try to over charge you so watch out.

title: great for sunset
review: The cenotaphs look particularly striking at sunset. A bit far from the centre of Jaisalmer but you can get to it by taxi.

title: Historical site with beautiful architecture
review: This "desert garden", containing royal cenotaphs, is great for a short visit. Went during the day for a few photographs (probably would be nicer at sunset). There are guides that will explain the history for a fee, however I don't think it's worth it. Was even offered an desert oil massage O.O (sketchy/creepy). Don't expect much from this place. Was a pit stop on the way to our camel trekking tour. Not a must-see attraction.

title: Visited Bada Bagh
review: Average place where you get charged by Rs 50 per person. These are ruins surrounded by a man made lake, did not go inside as a guide was pestering us.

title: So beautiful, not cared for properly
review: Here is one of those places that is "Good-Bad". It is a spectacular historical site, but in spite of the collection of a stipend at the site for the "upkeep of the cenotaphs", which in fact are the responsibility of the local maharaja family, this has become a hang out for gangs to drink, smoke, and whatever. There is broken glass and litter everywhere, to the point of being a hazard. This does not take away from the essential beauty of these monuments, which are breathtaking from the moment they appear on the horizon, to the time you observe them up close and see the inscriptions and carving indicating the royal families they honor. It would be nice if they were respected a bit more by either the royal family or the locals. They are a legacy, a beautiful landmark, a place of historical importance, as well as a source of income for locals. I would say, still worth a visit. Be cautious of the gangs of young men, however,especially if you have any young ladies with you.

title: amazing architecture.
review: Stunning place, with so much history.   The architecture is just mind blowing.  We did not use the local guides as our driver was able to provide us with all the necessary information.

title: Secluded and mysterious
review: We visited the cenotaphs early morning (as advised), It was very beautiful indeed and so peaceful !

title: Like an old ghost city near jaisalmer
review: its like 6-8 kms away from Jaisalmer city and a small park surrounded with maharraja style tombs.

title: Great architecture
review: It is very near to Jaisalmer city. One of the beautiful designed and crafted place near city area. Place is known as Ghost city or mysterious place. If you are at Jaisalmer try to visit this place it is having very good historical pillars and domes.

title: The chatris of Ram Bagh were constructed over a century and latest one even has a colour photograph of the gentleman
review: This is surely the best tourist spot Jaisalmer has to offer, after the Fort. We went in the hot month of August, so there was no one there when we showed up at 11 am, except for an intrepid village teen who offered to by our "guide" for Rs 100. He pointed out a few interesting details, but you don't really need a guide here. The place is awesome in its architectural beauty. Yes, these 'chatris' are for dead royalty (note: they're not buried here; they were cremated and these monuments were erected later in their memory). Some people complain the wind mills put up nearby distract from the beauty of Bada Bagh, but I think they provide an interesting contrast: new technology meets traditional antiquity. You could do a round of the place and leave in 15 minutes, but I recommend you take some time, sit and absorb the place.

title: Bada Bagh (not a garden as such)
review: We visited the same during evening hours.  It was very beautiful indeed.  There are guides (unofficial) who charge a buck and brief you about the place and its importance.

title: Romentic, plan during sunset.
review: Do not miss this magical place on your visit! Must have seen it in dozens of movies. We went there during sunset, hired a guide, and must say it was just amazing experience and peacful time spent.

title: Lovely
review: A small beautiful place just few kms from the city. We visited this place on our way to sand dunes. A very good drive.Windmills on either side of the road.A guide was available at a very reasonable cost . Do not miss this if you are in Jaisalmer. Good place to take photos.

title: Architecture Miracle!!
review: Worth watching. The interlocking mechnism used in Past is still holding the Tomb, were as the new age Cement Tombs were demolished during earth quake.

title: Historical place,Recommended
review: It is not a big place, you can probably finish it in 30-45 minutes. But it is worth visiting, and do take a guide available there for nominal fee. The story of the place is interesting, it is actually a memorial for all the kings and their queens. It is few kms away from the city, recommended u take a taxi and cover Bada baghm, kuldhara and jain temple.

title: Regally in memoriam
review: Located about 6 km north-west of Jaisalmer city, these cenotaphs are stunning.  They seem to emerge from the rocks they are built on and have the same colour as the landscape.  The base of the cenotaph is either square or hexagonal.  There is no painting or sculpture inside the domes which are circular, square or like a pyramid.

title: Get-a-way from the hustle and bustle
review: Get-a-way from the hustle and bustle of the city. Go enjoy this beautiful and mysterious place. This ancient graveyard is filled with artitectural beauties. It's a sea of Dr. Seuss onion domes. How many different dome styles can you find? Contemplate which architectural styles are the newer and which are the super ancient! It's a great place for sunsets! Ah Jaisalmer!

title: Good quite place to hangout
review: The place is nothing but a series of domes where it is said that there are saamadhis of saints.

title: Never knew that need to pay to visit the royal cenotaph
review: Had to buy a ticket to get inside the protected area. Was here for 30 minutes and wanted to know the history behind the royal cenotaphs. Since no guide was available here, took some photos and went back. If you would like to take photos, go either by morning or evening.The rising or setting Sun imparts a golden color to the yellow sand stone cenotaphs which look even more beautiful.

title: Excellent place
review: The place is very beautiful and mind blowing. Thanks to the government for maintaining in such a manner.

title: historical place
review: must visit if you are at jaisalmer. nos. of big & small umbrellas built by former kings of jaisalmer in memory of kings/queens. though few are damaged but still must for visit.

title: Relics of the past
review: Bada Bagh is a short drive from Jaisalmer.

title: “Sunrise is best”
review: I visited Bada Bagh twice, once during the day to explore and scout for photo opportunities and secondly for sunrise for the photography. I did enjoy both visits, it's a very unique place and when we visited devoid of any other visitors. Being there at sunrise was very special, extremely peacful and quiet

title: Royal Resting Place
review: An amazing place containing the cenotaphs of past Royalty  of Jiasalmer. Location is very good with a high ground and a commanding view of the surroundings especially the wind mills and sunset and quite atmosphere. Though the sad part is, many of the cenotaphs have been vandalised, quite a few of them totally broken and the stones lying in disarray. Such disrespect could have been prevented by the local administration

title: Fascinating
review: The cenotaphs are interesting on your own, but will be even more fun if you accept the services of one of the young guides. We had someone called Aryan, who was enthusiastic and fairly on-the-ball.

title: Walk into history
review: Impressive Chhatris in a beautiful desert setting. Walk around with a guide for better understanding of the history. Click to your heart's content with beautiful angles. Worth a visit

title: Waste of time
review: Don't waste your time visiting here. This place is not maintained properly and on top of that you will be charged around Rs. 100 to visit this place. Its collection of epitaphs (Graveyard).

title: Nice architecture
review: Nice view of windmills and good architecture. The place is built in memory of various kings of Jaisalmer. Its a bit away from the city but has cool calmeness.. It can be developed as a good tourist spot as right now its not maintained that way.

title: Chattri's of Kings and his queens
review: A great place to see the Chattri's (burial) ground of Kings of Jaisalmer on a hillock. Don't forget to take a guide, who can only explain you in details about the story of this place.

title: Royal Cenotaph!
review: Nice spot for a quiet time with family.

title: Nice place
review: There is little to see here, except for an old heritage site. You can visit this site only if you have a lot of time to spare.

title: Sunrise is best
review: I visited Bada Bagh twice, once during the day to explore and scout for photo opportunities and secondly for sunrise for the photography.

title: Bada Bagh
review: new view of old heritage...on a distance of say 7-8kms from Jaisalmer. good place to click some photos...esp in evenings. Not great maintenance as of now...

title: Interesting
review: It is interesting if you hire a guide and they tell you the story of how these burials are made...

title: Special place
review: Somehow the place made me want to be quiet and reverential. After all royalty is buried here, under beautiful golden cenotaphs. The desert lends a mystic air to everything...and the blue sky above, such a rarity in India!

title: A beautiful palce of architecture
review: Its a cremation ground of Rawals ( maharaja of jaisalmer). they make a satri (umbrella like structure) after death of a king on that place.

title: Danger
review: A good site full of interesting history. However be on high alert as strong young men posing as tour guilds will lead you down the back and insist on being paid?? 200r. hard to get away from when they corner you.

title: good for early morning or sunrise! but don't expect much beyond photographing opportunity!
review: These are burial ground where the royal family is cremated. this place is located out of town on highway. The road near CRPF camp leads you to bada bagh. There is entry charge to be paid. Yes, cameras also are charged for! The place is owned by royal family.

title: Cremation ground for the Kings
review: A place once used for cremation, now opened for tourist purposes. During sunset it's great as the stones look more golden. Outside the city so have to ride up with car or auto-rickshaw. If you are interested in history, ask the locals, but avoid people posing as guides. Fees taken are supposed to be used for maintenance of the structures.

title: Beautiful and peaceful
review: A very beautiful place which is 5-6 kilometers from the main city. You must visit to catch the sunset. Don't be fooled by the guides there - they are only there to fleece tourists.

title: a nice excursion
review: This place was recommended to us by locals. We went there for about three quarters of an hour just before sunset. I think this is the minimum time to visit. You could also spend some more time, just sitting around there, having a picknick or reading or writing a travel diary.

title: Tasteful
review: Beautiful cremation ground. You could skip this one. This is outside the city of Jaisalmer. Nothing much to see from inside.Looks grand from the fort.

title: pl dont go
review: waste of time and money. very disappointing to see these places as these may be managed well but the govt just levy the entry fees and dont bother to maintain it

title: Where souls rest
review: The overall view of the lined umbrellas is very impressive .its a good idea to read up on it before you go .the guide there was not great .the gardens around it are not just a bit of green and not well maintained .

title: Chhatris of Maharajas of Jaisalmer
review: Bada Bagh is a garden complex about 6 km from Jaisalmer on way to Ramgarh (Tanot). It contains a set of royal cenotaphs  of  The Maharajas of Jaisalmer state, starting with Jai Singh till the recent ones

title: Best at sunset
review: Be here at sunset to get best pictures. This was burial ground for the royal family. The architecture is good and there are local guides who will charge you nominal fees of Rs. 100.00 to explain things around.

title: Has a history of its own
review: Good place to visit in Jaisalmer. Only place which is green to an extent in Jaisalmer. Guides can help you understand the way the location is built up.

title: A good and quiet place, lot of photography optons
review: This is a 6-7 kms far from city and we hired a auto to reach there. Auto charged us 150 bucks for a return journey. There was no crowd when we reached there. This is a good photogenic place and there is a lot of photography opportunities. Here, also I found that the cleanliness is not maintained otherwise this is a quite good place. 1 or 2 guides offered their service to us but we politely refused and they went away.

title: Very poorly maintained
review: Our experience was affected by some unauthorised people blocking our car from entering the Bada Bagh complex - they demanded a hefty entry fee. Our driver had to negotiate a lower entry fee. I am sure the Govt can manage this better - take a legal fee and maintain the complex!

title: Serene
review: The chhatris or royal cenotaphs are marvelous pieces of architecture. They look serene in the back drop of wind mills. The memorial of Sati is thought provoking

title: May be a good sun-set point.......
review: just 4-5 kms away on bank of the city, bada bagh is located but nothing like bagh(garden). this is the place where cremation of royal family members takes place.It requires a good care and can be develop as a attractive tourist point as this is the very accurate and adequate Sun-Set point among hundreds of wind mills, presently not suitable to go alone, even no justification of entry-fee.

title: Beautiful and peaceful
review: Completely worth stopping here on your way to a camel safari, or to make a short trip out of Jaisalmer for a few hours to see it if you have the time. Beautiful and peaceful cenotaphs, and great fun to photograph.

title: Complete waste of time
review: No point going there.there is nothing at all.it is far from the city.It is cremation ground of the royal ...which is not at all maintained.

title: a hauntingly beautiful place
review: This is a really beautiful place. But beware of the scattered broken beer glasses around. Best visited at sunset

title: remembering the past
review: a quiet place just outside the city to view the cenotaphs built in honour of past rulers. go there when the sun is setting for beautiful photos. i hope the 100 rupees collected will go into maintaining the ancient structures some of which are crumbling.

title: Lovely site to spend a few minutes
review: This is an excellent place to spend a few minutes when on your way out to the Thar desert for a safari. it's an easy trip out from the city as well. The cenotaphs are lovely to behold in the sunlight, no matter what the time, although sunset seems to be best! Read a bit about the site before going or pay for a local guide to give yourself a fuller appreciation.

title: Nice place to be around sunset
review: good architecture can be found here & a clear distinction of tombs made during hindu rulers era & during Mughal rulers era ... nice work on sandstones ... one must visit if you are in Jaisalmer

title: Lovely spot for sunset
review: I visited Bada Bagh twice - once on a misty mid-morning, and then again for sunset. It's not too far from Jaisalmer - a 20 minute drive or so, on decent roads. You have to pay a small entrance fee, and you might get hassled a bit by young men touting as guides. But the place is interesting to see, even though one of two of the cenotaphs are crumbling a bit due to a recent earthquake and lack of maintenance. I found the site pretty clean, and at sunset it really came into its own, with some stunning views across the desert, which is strewn with silhouetted wind turbines in the distance. Worth a visit.

title: Better to visit either at sunrise or sunset
review: Cenotaphs of royal family members of Jaisalmer are there at Bada Bagh. These cenotaphs are constructed on a hillock. These are beautiful cenotaphs/memorials though some of them have been damaged either by nature or by people. Its strange that authorities could not save damage to these structures which are part of the heritage, though they charge entry fee from visitors. These are memorials of Hindu royal family members, first time I have seen such memorials which are almost equivalent to Mughal era tombs (smaller ones), or even more beautiful from some smaller tombs. Place is to be visited by paying due respect to the deceased people, do not climb on cenotaphs with shoes. Lot of windmills can be seen from there, which is a great view. I visited this place at sunrise and it was excellent view.

title: Poor maintanence
review: The authority here collects 50rs per person and another 50 for camera as maintenance charges. But this place is poorly maintained even though it is of historical importance. Worth spending a few minutes during sunset

title: Nice but poor management
review: The chattris of past rajas of jaisalmer are nicely carved and numerous. But their  history is not clear and although there's an entry of 50/- there are no facilities near the complex.visit at sunset for best view.

title: Amazing Photo Ops place
review: I had been to this place in Oct 2014 with my family. At first we read that this place is all about the chhatris in memory of the different rajas from Jaisalmer but when we reached that place it seemed completely deserted except the person giving the tickets and one or two local guides. At first we were reluctant to hire the services of guide but we met this amazing kid who was studying and kept on insisting that he wants to tell about this place and was ready to share the information even if we dint want to pay him. Finally we agreed to hire him not for the information but the interest and zeal with which he was after us and being a student he is trying to make some money to help his studies.

title: Beautiful structures
review: If you like taking photographs, you should definitely visit bada bagh. Its 20 minutes away from central Jaisalmer but worth the visit.

title: good place for sunset
review: this place is little far from city and can be visited during evening time to get relaxed in evening while watching sunset. its a very quit place.

title: hot but impressive
review: it was extremely hot to visit this site but it was worth it to wander around. Of course if you accept the assistance of one of the very friendly young men offering to be your guide, you will be expected to pay. the tombs are an extraordinary experience when you understand their age and their intelligent architecture to withstand time and weather. great stop over on your way out over the Thar desert.

title: Amazing Sunset through the Cenotaphs
review: I loved the place majorly because of its beautifully architectured Cenotaphs and vast barren land on all the sides of it..It has lot of windmills around..I loved the air of the place...the serene sunset through the Cenotaphs was simply Breath-taking.The pleasant breeze all across the place blows your mind away..

title: Magic sunset
review: Perfect place to see the sunset! Historical place with a awesome architecture, very peaceful. The entry costs 100 rupees and the experience is unforgettable.

title: Thousands of years of history just envelop you...
review: We didn't originally expect to stop at this little detour as we drove out of Jaisalmer originally.  But, I'm so glad we did.  It was such an amazing experience to stand in a thousands years old, ornately carved structure and just feel the history that abounded.  I wish that we had more information about what we were seeing while I was there.  But I took many, many photos, and some video.  And a quick jaunt on Wikipedia later, and I felt much more informed and satisfied with what we saw.  Worth the trip.

title: unimaginable place
review: This place is a little away from jaisalmer, in the heart of desert, But I was surprised to see the lush green area here.  The magnificient architecture of cemetery of the royal family is breathe taking. The golden colour of each structure, similar to buildings everywhere in jaisalmer, was simply majestic. It would be better if goverment could take over the monument for its maintainence, as many of the buildings were in bad condition. I was impressed by the knowledge of the place small village boy due to his knowledge of the place, he acted guide to us.

title: Yes but with a guide
review: Lovely location, great history, nice architecture... If you do happen to visit then please take the guide.. Charged us ₹100.. He was worth it coz without the information it's just any other pretty Rajasthani structure...

title: A place to be at Leisure
review: Bad Bagh is Cenotaphs of the Maharawals of Jaisalmer, constructed centuries back. Standing at these beautifully architectured  cenotaphs amid wide un-inhabited and empty land give you a very peaceful feeling with cool breeze blowing across. There are several windmills around, which gave me a very awe feeling, as I had hardly seen windmills till then.

title: Good from history perspective
review: This place is good from history perspective however it's not very tourist friendly. The path is full of stones and not easy to walk. Can be made smoother for easy walk.

title: Sunset at bada Bagh - beautiful
review: Glad we were able to catch the sunset at this site, it was gorgeous. So many cenotaphs, umbrellas and windmills mixed with views of the sunset was a great experience.

title: Cynotaphs, umbrella shaped memorials, picturesque
review: This is a great place do hire guide Rahul, he charges INR 100 - 150, Has great knowledge of teh place, this place has been visited for many movie shoots. you can click a lot of pics here but remember this is a memorial, i am a bit superstitious so did not click pics but a beautiful place, you can see wind mills all over as ewll and enjoy sunny mornings or sunset here... net net you will love the place...

title: Another attraction worthy of top 5 in your list
review: Its a site where cenotaph of rulers of Jaisalmer are there. Extremely beautiful especially if you visit at sun-set. The cenotaphs turn orange in the setting sun which is an extremely beautiful site for your eyes and for your cameras.

title: Absolute waste of time
review: I wonder why anybody would visit this place. It is filthy with several umbrellas that all look almost the same. Don't be fooled that it is a garden. It is not. It is a set of old relics that have not been maintained but they charge a bomb for entry.

title: Old meets new...
review: Only 6kms out of Jaisalmer, Bada Bagh was established in the 16th Century for royal cremations and "sati".  There are two examples of cenotaphs Bhati and Moghul, and the area is surrounded on the horizon by modern wind turbines, giving an odd contrast between the old India and the new.  A guide helps to explain the history and establishment of the cenotaph's and it is beautiful at sunset.

title: Quite picturesque and unique
review: Have seen quite a few chattries of the rajputs but this one seems to be different, in the sense of the structures and location. The yellow stone makes the structures a visual delight. There is nothing much here except for the chattries, which are beautiful especially with the sunrise and sunset. From photography POV it's good and a nice point to shoot as its different from the rest. But as a tourist it can be skipped.

title: Must see
review: There is Chattries of Kings, which are beautiful especially sunset.For photography it looks good.

title: Good for photography
review: most suitable to visit at the time of sunset for good snaps of typical Rajasthan structures. Place is not well maintained, and felt it is full of negative vibes.

title: Windmills and Rajasthan Architecture
review: Bada Bagh is your classic Rajasthan Architecture....breathtaking, captivating, filled with details that will make you lose sense of time.

title: Great photography
review: We visited Bada Bagh around sunset and had some great photography. We had one of the locals provide a tour for a very reasonable Rs. 100 and thoroughly enjoyed the visit.

title: Boring Place
review: If you are a solo backpacker kind of traveler, avoid this boring place as its just a waste of time. Secluded place outside the town and if you specially go to watch this place, you will be disappointed. Otherwise good for foreigners, senior citizens who might find the stories interesting

title: Architectural beauty
review: Hi

title: Place for relaxation
review: The place gives you the feeling that India is also working towards Clean Energy & Green Power. The place has a lot of windmills & the breeze is awesome to sit back & relax.

title: Looks better from a distance
review: The array of tombs is a sight from a distance but nothing charming about it when you go in.It is a private property, 30rs ticket, absolutely no maintenance. Broken glass and beer bottles are strewn around

title: Picturesque Place
review: Nice mix of Islamic and hindu architecture. Its a royal cremation ground and its history shows some great work done by past kings to make this area green. As I alway say, hire a guide (if you can afford) coz that will provide the soul (story) to the body (to you tour) and help u take Photographs if you are a couple or even with friends :) and source of income to locals.

title: nice at sunset
review: Nice place to visit at sunset time. We reached around 6 in evening and left at 7 after sunset. Looks beautiful with chaatris and wind mills all around, set amidst a lot of green area ( as it is the biggest green area of Jaisalmer)

title: Again well built but worst managed place
review: Nice sculpture and peaceful area.. Resting place of Ravals (Kings) of Jaislamer.. However its again not been properly maintained.. Its absolutely unclean..

title: Monumental grave domes
review: This was a pleasant surprise.  Take a motor bike down to this place. The structures are very detailed. This is the place where the ashes of royalty are kept. The shapes differ for males and females.

title: Very Picturesque!
review: It is 6 kms north of Jaisalmer before Lodhruva,

title: love ths place
review: ths place makes me feel happy...i would like to visit again.. perfect place for photoshoot in ethnic wear.. dont miss to visit ths place

title: Remains of history
review: The place is well advertised. However, from a tourist point of view it is not so great. It contains cenotaphs of the royal family, but today it is lying without any care. The cenotaphs of the Bramhins (Vyas) on the edge of the city is a better place to visit. That point is also much better for sunset photography. Perhaps due to this reason visitors to this place is also very few.

title: Not very well maintained
review: A must visit though not very well maintained. It's better to hire a guide here else not much to understand looking at the place

title: Nothing to see there
review: Its funeral place of old royal families some of Chhatris are already destroyed and they even dont repair it and charging Rs.50 PP entry fee for that also.

title: In the wilderness.
review: Bada bagh are ruins in the middle of nowhere. The place is okay as a pit-stop to the dunes. Its quite good for photography though, specially during sunset.

title: Worth visiting place in the evening
review: A beautiful place to visit in the evening, seeing the traditional Cenotaps of royal family made by generation after generation. very peaceful place. Jaisalmer trip is not complete without visiting it

title: BEAUTIFULLY MADE: PICTURESQUE & CALM
review: The place is beautiful... go around the sunset time and see the sunset from there... very calm, not so crowded place...

title: Last resting place of the royal family of Jaisalmer
review: These are the cenotaphs of the royaly family of Jaisalmer i.e. an empty tomb erected in honour of a person who dies and whose remains are somewhere else.

title: Beautiful
review: Fantastic place to click some great pics and just wander around amidst history. Calming surroundings...worth a visit! However, people who can't climb/walk rough terrain will not be able to enjoy this place or see it upclose. Wear good walking shoes.

title: Photographer's paradise
review: Just 6 kms from the Jaiselmer city and one of the best places to visit in jaisalmer. Though the place is not well maintained but that gives a very rustic feel to Bada Bagh. If you are into photography then this is a must go place. Do read a little bit about history of jaisalmer before visiting bada bagh

title: Royal Cenotophs
review: The royal cenotphs are really nice to watch for photography and nice place to explore.

title: Beautiful Solitude
review: Well worth the trip. Quite desolate, makes an impact. Strangely the wind turbines that dot the landscape around this sacred site add an even stronger sense of isolation.

title: Dreary and dusty
review: Don't bother going here. You have to pay an entry fee and parking fee, and nothing is offered for your money. There are random unemployed guys masquerading as tour guides, but of course they seek additional payment. Why would you want to visit a group of dusty dilapidated cenotaphs on a hillside in the desert which no-one has even bothered to link by pathways? You just scramble around and try to make sense of what you're looking at. A waste of time. No amenities are available at all.

title: Peaceful final resting place for kings
review: Bada bagh has multiple structures on hill top. Its amazing place to enjoy the sunset.  You can take very nice photographas at evening.  Take guide and listen to interesting history.  Nice and windy you can also view many wind mills arrround the area.

title: Lots of History and Very Scenic
review: As you drive up to Bada Bagh, it looks like a collection of small and intricately designed buildings. Most might get out of their car, snap a photo and keep driving by but I highly recommend that you go there, hire a guide for RS 150-200 (we paid 200) and soak in some of the history of the place. There are some great examples of architecture over the ages as well as plenty of local folklore that the guides can impart.

title: Close to History but far from maintainence
review: Nice place if you love history but around 6-7 kms from main city. Full of cenotaphs and surrounded by WINDMILLS

title: Stunning light before sunset
review: Very quiet and peaceful and almost an after thought visit. Well worth paying a local to explain the place otherwise a bit pointless. Shame about the wind farm surrounding it though ! Typical Indian non planning in action to ruin great views !

title: Nice Cenotaphs!
review: The architecture, the structure, their colour so much in sync with the desert look very beautiful. Wonderfully crafted structures!

title: Pretty, good for photos, cheap entry fee
review: This place is a nice quick (20 minute) stop on the way to a camel safari or, I suppose, if you're just staying in the town.  I think you could skip it if you're not going on the camel safari but if you are it's worth a stop.  Very pretty.

title: Peaceful !
review: The final destination of Maharajas of Jaisalmer..I couldn't resist going to this beautiful crematorium twice..Peacefully Beautiful..there always cool breeze which goes in ur head.. then i also met a very sweet boy (must not be more than 12 years) who guided me with his tooti footi english mixed with local language.. i spent a lot of time there.. its a place for people who wanna hear the sound of wind..

title: Average
review: The ruined temples are average but view outside with so many windmills is mesmerizing..picturesque...visit the place for this view if nothing else..

title: average bada bagh
review: average bada bagh not so clean  but me and my family enjoyed ....!!  its an average place but we find it very shooting and calm ...therefore this place is a pleasent place..

title: BEAUTIFULLY MADE: PICTURESQUE & CALM
review: Do't forget you are going to a cemetery. Indians do not normally go to cemeteries unlike Westerners, but the Cenotaps or Chattris of the royal family of Jaisalmer is a must visit, when you are in Jaisalmer. The area is calm and peaceful, extremely picturesque. Bada Bagh is on the Jaisalmer-Ramgarh Road and can be visited while enroute / on the way back to / from Tanot Mata Mandir. The view of the setting sun from the Cenotaps with the windmills being highlighted is beautiful.

title: Disappointing
review: Sandwiched between the border lands road authority and a field of wind turbines, we found this place downright depressing. It is poorly maintained, strewn with garbage and there has been little or no attempt at restoration.  The older monuments are the more interesting.  Makes one wonder where the entry fee goes..the entry fee for the abandoned villages is less and there you can see the value added.  There are better placed to watch the sunset around Jaisalmer.

title: very picturesque
review: The place is beautiful... go around the sunset time and see the sunset from there... very calm, not so crowded place...

title: Could be better...
review: If they cleaned this place up, it could be a great attraction. Unfortunately, it's a venue littered with garbage and inhabited by fake guides looking to make a few quick rupees off of you.

title: Excellent interiors and architecture
review: The Bada Bagh is a nice place set among a garden slightly north of Jaisalmer. we got the feeling of Historic Culture as soon as we entered the premises! Excellent interiors and architecture. The pillar of Entrance like Royal. Unexpected wonderful set of cenotaphs (Only for Royal Families), in the desert. Very few people around, very special carved architecture.

title: Very dissopointing
review: We thought it is some big thing It is beautiful no doubt

title: Nice place
review: After visiting so much haveli' and fort's it doesnt feels so attractive. But should visit it  for 10 min.

title: Worth a stop
review: It's worth a stop on the way to the desert camel ride. These cenotaphs are very scenic and there are good photo opportunities there

title: Bada Bagh
review: It is a pity that this place does not figure highly among the places to be viewed in Jaisalmer. This is one of the best looking monument of Jaisalmer. We went during the day time and it looked beautiful. Some more efforts on part of the rajasthan tourism towards its maintenance will bring in more tourism.  Definitely deserves a visit.

title: Seriously awesome place to be
review: Bada (Big) Bagh (Garden) is actually the cremation ground of the royal families. I would strongly recommend to take a guide, other wise the pace is just tombs...he will tell the importance of the place. you can trace the history to some thousand years. It was nice to know the royalty of the Jaisalmer kings.

title: Royal Cenotaphs
review: Bada Bagh - the cremation ground of the royal families is situated about a ten minute drive from Jaisalmer.   This is a wonderful collection of lovely sandstone carved cenotaphs densely crowded together on a hillside.  A photographer’s delight, although sadly the ugly windmills in the near distance offer a stark contrast to the setting. The mausoleums are interesting to have a look around although there is little or no information on them.  That said, the area itself is regrettably not kept very well with garbage and broken bottles strewn around.   Sad to see such an important site being neglected by the authorities. Worth a short visit if you have the time.

title: Terrible
review: Surroundings not maintained and looks like garbage dump.

title: Beautiful place
review: It is a place worth to visit. There a guy came after us posing as a guide. He told the story of the place which we dont know how true it is. Its better to do some research on net before going there.

title: Valley of the Kings Raj style
review: We visited this wonderful Royal tomb site and found ourselves alone there which made it even more atmospheric.  About 10 minutes by rickshaw outside Jaisalmer it is very much a must see.  133 tombs of Raj royalty lie here on a ridge facing the sunset and the dawn.  Lovely sandstone carved tombs.

title: A nice view point
review: The place of Royal Cenotaph is a nice place to visit. Many mantaps (I read somewhere 133) are seen. The view from this elevated place is nice. As we went there, we got a bonus of nice sunset from this place. There is a large Windmill Farm seen from here.

title: Amazing history hidden in Bada Bagh..
review: We visited the place in Dec 2013. The cenotaphs is a great place for photo enthusiasts. We hired a guide who explained the history behind the Cenotaphs. The cenotaphs are architecturally beautiful however some of the dome shaped Cenotaphs were impacted by the major Gujarat earthquake.

title: Beautiful scenin and serene
review: Great place to visit for keen photographers and history seekers. It has beautiful cenotaphs dedicated to the various royal family members of Jaisalmer carved out of the beautiful golden sand stone.

title: Beautiful Tombs, a Photographers delight
review: A beautiful location having some 133 odd cenotaphs or tombs or "Chhatris" as the locals call it. This is carved in sandstone, each tomb dedicated to the royal family. You are not supposed to climb into the cenotaphs since each tomb seems to be dedicated to a deity. The cenotaphs are split between ones which on the ground and ones which are are higher up where you can reach post doing some skillful climbing.

title: Wonderful cenotaphs
review: Unexpected wonderful set of cenotaphs, in the desert. Very few people around, very special carved architecture. A quick visit (20' - 30') is really worthwhile.

title: Great sunset photographs
review: Worth a trip outside of town to see especially near sunset. If you enjoy photography you will be able to take some nice picture. There is a wind farm in the distance, which did not bother me as it did some. Point the camera the other way and turn you back if they bother you. I actually liked them. To each his own.

title: An unexpected highlight of a trip to Jaisalmer
review: I recently visited Bada Bagh at sunset in January 2014 and I must say that I was enthralled. There were few people there and no touts or bogus "guides" around. I spent an enjoyable hour wandering around and watching the sun set on the very interesting architecture.

title: Royal Cemetary
review: The Bada Bagh is a nice place set among a garden slightly north of Jaisalmer. We met a great guide there who provided a tour and explanation for 200 Rupees and in general left us with a pretty nice feeling about the place.

title: Best photography site.
review: Bada bag is just 8 km away from jaisalmer . Its a must visit place recommended by many travel magazine.In hindi 'BADA' means Big and 'BAGH' means agricultural field. Mainly this place is surrounded by agricultural Field which is rare to see in a place like Jaisalmer. Once you visit this place you will come to know why it is recommended. The best time to visit this place is during the sunset. During  the winter time early morning visit could be painful due to the cold weather.This place is a place for all the Temples which are made by different king during there kingdom. This place is calm ,cool and away from local rush.You can spend an hour here just enjoy the place. Don't forget to take your camera.

title: Charming place to visit early morning or evening
review: It's a quiet and charming set of chattris not far from Jaisalmer, but I'd say - visit it in the evening or in the morning, it's too hot in daytime :)

title: Raul the college history student was great
review: Arrived early morning and met Raul who lives in the village next to Bada Bagh. His knowledge and friendliness really helped us understand the, history and the significance of the cenotaphs. If you come all the way to Jaiselmer then you should make the effort to go to Bada Bagh.

title: The cenotaphs are worth a visit.
review: The royal cenotaphs are well maintained and worth a visit. It is interesting to see the changes in architecture over generations. Wish they had the family history on display.

title: It is a cenotaph
review: As it is a cenotaph, I would never prefer to visit the place. The place is good and the view of sun set is even better than other places.

title: very good
review: its very good and i like it cause it is peaceful.its beautiful and quite safe.there is no disturabance of anything.when i been there its good cause no many peoples inside there.

title: Go only if you are interested in photography.
review: This is a burial place of Maharajas and their kin. Slightly away from the city. An average place for a commoner but a good place if you are interested in photography.

title: Bada beautiful... Thank you Hira!
review: Decided to make stop at Bada Bagh on our way out of Jaisalmer in the early morning. What a great place! Fabulous photos with little other tourists in the morning sunshine was wonderful. We opted to hire a young local to tell us about the site by the name of Hira. Fabulous! This calm and very not-pushy young man was insightful,  early well spoken and provided us with information about Bada Bagh, cast society in India, religious history on several worshipped gods and more. With a clear love of history, this sincere young man impressed me by providing a wider breadth of education on Indian culture in our short visit then most of the guides in our whole trip. Look for him if you go.... He was great! HIRA!

title: Beautiful Cenotaphs
review: Bada bagh is a must visit for any photography enthusiastic, the place offers excellent opportunities for  photographers. the place is architecturally very beautiful and picturesque. it is quite and peaceful. the wind mills offer a stark contrast to the settings. worth a visit

title: Must See
review: Must visit on any trip to Jaisalmer. It is really sad to see the memorials for the Sati queens... one portion of the Indian history that is cruel.

title: Photogenic Bada Bagh
review: We visited Bada Bagh on a trip to the Sam sand dunes.

title: At sunset
review: A great place to visit.  Sad to say a few children begging - good idea to not have any money and to not take their pictures even though they suggest it.  I seriously didn't have any money on me but did take a picture of a young girl after she insisted.  She hassled me even when I was in the car - which was very sad.

title: A Place for photographers
review: This place is located about 4-5kms from jaisalmer town. Its been shown to tourist by almost all tour heading towards sand dunes. These are nothing but cenotaphs for royal families and war heroes. They charge about 50Rs for camera.

title: Nice place to take photographs
review: Once you are in Jaisalmer you have to go to Bada Bagh in the evening to see the sunset and take nice photographs. It is about 6-7 kms away from the town. These are cenotaphs which have a good view during sunset. These are nicely preserved and attract lot of tourists. I am sure there are lot of Bollywood movies that have been shot here so once we see this place we tend to remember having seen it earlier. One can go here just before sunset and not more than 1 hour in total needs to be spent here. Minor entrace fee is also charged. Please note to take a autorick and keep it waiting as getting conveyance back might be difficult.

title: Interesting place
