review: We went to Bada Bagh in our way to the Thar dessert. I found this place quite beautiful, especially if you have never seen these types of cenotaphs before.After a while walking around it gets a bit monotonous and you just want to continue with your trip.

title: Another series of temples/historical buildings
review: Probably the time of the day etc counts. For us it was the last visit on a long day, had been to several temples with not much to see. Arrived here, cover charge of course though not much they all add up. We were the only ones here and got hit by the aggressive touts and want to be guides who wouldn't leave us alone. in the end we got sick of the continual attention and left without seeing to much.

title: Such beauty
review: Very close to Jaisalmer town, it is such a beautiful place.It is like going back in time.Everything you imagine you would see in India and such a romantic spot.

title: Nice gardens
review: I didnt go inside the gardens as it was hot. However they looked beautiful from outside. best time to visit is evening 0r morning.

title: Pay hafty ticket to see ruins
review: The entry ticket is Rs.50 per person, the path inside is rocky and slippery hence one need to be careful while climbing the hills. The approach path could be paved for visitors. Quite far from the city, no regrets if you skip it.

title: Comparatively, okay
review: The cenotaphs of the rulers of Jaisalmer were an interesting visit.  Compared with other cenotaph locations, less 'picturesque' - and, along with others, a lack of information on display.

title: Bada Bagh
review: This is one of the most incredible places in the world (and it is about 35 years that I travel!).

title: Silent tomb in jaisalmer
review: Around 6 km from jaisalmer fort, we found this fort. Surrounded by garden, these cenotaph are build to commemorate the royal family.we came in the afternoon, had no guide with me but the story of it had been digested into my mind.each cenotaph was built for each bhatti rullers, and the combination of different in size and yellow stone just made them look amazing from every side. I almost forgot that they r actually silent tombs. They r just too beautiful...

title: Good place to click photographs
review: Like the heading says, visit this place to click good photographs, know a little bit more about the Kings of Jaisalmer. Few film sequences have been shot here, there are interesting stories associated with few of the kings - which would be other specialties. Entry fee was quite high and maintenance was not up to the mark - with that money, they can maintain it better

title: Go,Get Pics Clicked!!
review: The cenotaphs are beautiful indeed, especially for those who want to learn primitive method of putting domes over structures.One side presents a very beautiful green picture. But there is monotony due to repetition of chattris which is very, very boring. Apart from those who have an interest in learning architecture, this place might not please others.

title: A Nice Sunset Point
review: Bada Bagh is a nice place to see the sunset while setting among the cenotaphs of Maharajas. The beauty of the place is spoiled by the presence of hundreds of wind turbines around the area. From photography point of view these wind turbines are bit irritating while capturing the cenotaphs during sunset. At the entrance you will find few local touts who will keep bothering you to hire them as guide to tell the history of the place, but any good guide book will give you the same information. So hiring a guide at Bada Bagh is pointless. If you are in Jaisalmer, visit this place during sunset.

title: great place to see the sunset
review: It is a very good place to see sunset. Tuk tuk take 300 rupes from the town center to get there and back.

title: Bada Bagh @ Jaisalmer
review: Garden and Cenotaph meant for the royal family members. when someone from royal family dies his body is cremated and nothing is build for next one year. After a year his immediate hear will build basic structure without the roof. then next generation in the royal family with finish the structure as respect to their grand fathe.

title: Beautiful!
review: When we first told people that we wanted to visit Bada Bagh, we were discouraged saying there was nothing there just a 'graveyard'. We visited however, at sunset and were mesmerized by the cenotaphs or chattris. It was stunning and totally worth the visit.

title: Must see
review: For me, this was the highlight of my visit to Jaisalmer. The cenotaphs are fabulously beautiful around sunset. Their golden colour gets highlighted by the rays of the setting sun. There are lots of wonderful angles for photography, and since these structures are comparatively modern, their state of preservation is better than most other structures in Jaisalmer. Also, this spot is away from the city, therefore there is far less pollution, noise and crowding than other historical sites.

title: If you're in Jaisalmer
review: If you are in Jaisalmer,  you must put this on your to do list. Great anytime of the dsy but sunset is spectacular, go a bit early and get a guode to give you thr history, fascinating.

title: badabagh cenotaphs!!!
review: Bada Bagh, is a garden complex about 6 km north of Jaisalmer on way to Ramgarh or Tanot mandir and goes by the name badabagh cenotaphs(chhatris). Beautiful carvings on roofs and good place for photography. Just enjoy the peaceful environment , surrounded by windmills. Entry fees Rs 50 per head and camera chargable.

title: Only if you bring a good guide
review: I was fortunate enough to bring a tour guide. Without a guide to tell you the history and stories of the maharawals the visit would be subpar. Yes, of course the photography is good but you need to hear the stories of their lives to bring a cemetary...or cremation ground to life.

title: Lots of Chhatris
review: It is Royal family Cremation ground for Royal family. New cenotaph is made on the death of family member. It is completed by their grandsons. It is repeating from years. Small statues of kings & their queens are placed in the cenotaphs. Made of golden stones with lots of carving. Good to click photos there. A small lake & a garden with fruits trees & local vegatales can be seen from top. Lots of wind turbines installed in the area. Guide tells about sunrise & sunset from here looks good, we are not able to catch.

title: Very good cluster of monuments
review: I had amazing time sitting among the chhatris of Bada Bagh. I almost meditated as you witness the history that has passed by. The backdrop of Bada Bagh has power generation through windmills!

title: Nice to visit
review: A gud place to see and enjoy. This place has a lot of history attached to it as it consists of graves of a no. of Kings of Jaisalmer. A gud view from this place as it is placed at somewhat height from rest of the place. There are a no.  of windmills on the road to it which present great views

title: Lovely and deserted
review: Other than a few kids selling maps and requesting pens there was nobody to be seen when we went to Bada Bagh at sunset. The colors of the chattries were astounding and made for great pics. We rented a scooter from Jaisalmer and enjoyed the short ride. Later we went to a nearby temple which was surrounded by peacocks.

title: Serene
review: Bada Bagh, about 5km from the city, contains cenotaphs of the Jaisalmer royalty. It has peaceful and serene atmosphere. There was no one about when we visited except for a few guides.

title: Bada Bagh
review: we went there by taki  starting 2 hours before sunset and enjyed this beautiful romantic place deserted by tourists that day.Beautiful view and photos when we  s first saw the cenotaphs and when we came back to the fortress at sunset

title: Wonderful architecture
review: You must visit this beautiful place on sunset. It will be you, the dogs and pigeons only. Enjoy the silence and the wonderful architecture of this very well maintained place.

title: sunset view....
review: I have been there many times ,morning ,afternoon , evenings ..... every time I been had different color ,the best is I like is the sunset time . I was there mostly for sunset ,its beautiful sunset on hill ,other side is beautiful garden and trees ,on those trees many different birds has houses so come beck at sunset time ,its great fun to watch ...as its close to city .

title: mixed opinion
review: the location, architecture and sunset was wondurful, well worht the visit, try to catch the sunset at this place.

title: Tombs in the wind farms
review: Beautiful and worth the diversion.  Statues of kings with their wives who became satis.  It's a shame the huge windfarms dominate the landscape.

title: Bada Bagh
review: Worth the trip out there. We where the only ones there, except for the touts, but they let us alone when we said we did not need a guide.

title: Truly an Oasis amidst the desert
review: I would recommend visiting this place if you are in Jaisalmer. This place is shown in many hindi song sequences.

title: not well maintained
review: the lake is not maintained at all. really poor show. extremely unorganised. can be avoided completely except if yu want to visit the temple

title: A great place to rest for eternity
review: A fascinating place with amazing architecture. It is in need of some restoration but well worth a visit. Surprising it is now surrounded by wind turbines.

title: beautiful piece of landscape
review: The structure of Bada Bagh seems to grow from the sand. It looks like wind itself sculptured the architecture around there. If you are lucky apart from memorials you will see authentic Indian wedding ceremonies.

title: Nice place to see
review: Bada Bagh is situated about 6 kilometres from Jaisalmer on the way to Ramgarh.

title: A memorial.
review: This place was a cremation place for the royals, it is said. Its not a crowded place( no one except us was seen there) and as you enter some youths will follow you with request to hire them as the guide, which made us uncomfortable and we returned without fully seeing the place, also because it didn't seemed to be very interesting.

title: Great place for sunrise/sunset photography
review: This is a fairly frequented tourist spot that one should visit when in Jaisalmer. The cenotaphs at bada bagh are a photographers delights - with multiple-columns adorned by domed roofs, this gives you endless possibilities to play around with your composition. Suggest you go around sunrise or sunset

title: interesting architecture
review: This is a bit outside town (20 min-ish) but definitely should not be missed.   These are centopaths of former rulers of Jaisalmeer--- sites where each ruler was cremated and now commemorated with stone markers under an ornate domed structure for each person.     Well worth a visit!

title: Cool place
review: This is were the royalty rest in peace.  They have made monuments for all the past royalty.  It is a great place to visit.

title: Glorious sunest
review: Bada bagh is a royal cemetery, with moderate architectural beauty and a mildly intriguing history. However the sunset with the numerous windmills in the backdrop is absolutely stunning. The sky immediately post sunset was as colourful as I have ever seen and held us captivated for almost an hour. Highly recommended, only for the sunset

title: Great for sunset
review: Brilliant colours . Try going during the sunset and you will find a riot of colours around. Do not take a guide as there is not much detail in the history around here

title: Cenotaphs in the desert
review: On the way from Jaisalmer to Sam, the ruins of the royal cenotaphs provide a nice little stopover. The cenotaphs are closely set together. Some of these have very intricate stone carvings on the ceilings and lintels, and these are typically the cenotaphs of the more important rulers of the state. There are some stone signs labeling these. The lesser cenotaphs are unmarked, for relatively minor (now unidentified) members of the royal families.  I would not recommend taking a guide here. From the high ground on which these are situated, you get a wonderful view of the vista, with the wind farm towers all around this. The land is not all barren sand, but a mix of scrub and farm fields.

title: Frame it
review: if u watch indian bollywood movies, more than a dozen have been shot here for songs , actually the pics u r gonna click here look so amazing when u recheck them or go back home, the architecture is so brilliant.

title: Avoid
review: It is still a cremation site for the Brahmins. There is really not much to see. It is also not maintained in a good condition. No guide support, horrible sunset point. There is not much to see except few "chataris" (umbrellas)

title: good but need maintenace
review: Govt should focus on restoration of bada bagh. It seems that since the property does not belong to king/private party It has been deliberately left to ruin as a tourist spot to promote other places

title: Beautiful but high entrance fee
review: It was a beautiful site with the Wind Mills in the backgorund, but with an entrance fee of Rs 50 was a bit too much as the entrance fee ...

title: Cenotaphs
review: Splendid architecture, quiet and serene surroundings.The cenotaphs are well maintained and unlike many other places they are very clean. the sunset view from this area is amazing.

title: Heritage
review: Badabagh is the samadhis ( last rites were done there ) on which beautiful centophs were constructed. These centophs are architecturtal marvels combining muslim and hindu architecture and worth a visit. Best times are either at sunrise or sunset.

title: nice sunset
review: But be careful there are many touts. Would improve if was a bit more taken care of and more clean. But makes nice photos with the carved stones

title: stunning
review: stunning, peaceful, super architecture. A definate must visit when you are in the area. nothing around for miles.

title: BEST SUN SET
review: royal Samaritan for the jaisalmer royal family . when you come you can see a combination of carving and good engineering of jaisalmer state . the way is a bridge people make by hand one side is garden where you have tree of mango in this desert . another side big water lake . the sanotops have nice carving and from the top you can see best sun set view and this is only 7 k.m. far from town so you can enjoy with bike or Cybele .

title: The Royals rested here
review: Bada Bagh is known for the 'chhatris' that are constructed in memories of the royals who were cremeted here. Each such 'chhatri' is unique in itself and has a story to tell.

title: Amazing place and beautiful sunset
review: We reached there just before sunset and had good time around Royal Cenotaphs.

title: desolate and pretty
review: I loved this - we were the only people there and it was slightly surreal to see cenotaph after cenotaph - history undisturbed.

title: Beautiful at Sunset
review: Bada Bagh is a little off the main city, but the road leading to it is smooth. The place itself is clean and beautiful. While windmills kinda killed the sunset view, it was still nice being there in the evening.

title: Nice visit
review: Many wind mills can be seen from the location. The place is artistic and also soothing. Relaxes your body as well as your mind. Though there is not much to see but still its good for a one time visit

title: Absolutely go here!
review: This is a hidden gem and so many people miss it. Ask the Hotel owner to arrange a car to take you to the desert to camel ride and stop by here on the way. Stunning and surreal with the wind farm in the distance

title: Unbeatable pictures, no tourists in early AM
review: We went to Bada Bagh at about 7AM and no one else was there to enjoy the great scene.  Even though this is just a royal cemetery without anything much to read, it's worth it for the great pictures.  Even if you aren't a hard-core photog, you'll feel compelled to try to capture this unique site. Allow about 30 min for a visit.

title: sunset point
review: nice sunset. Again: experience of both tourists and locals would be improved if a major clean up was done.

title: Bada Bagh, the cenotaphs of the Jaisalmer Royal Family
review: This beautiful set of cenotaphs is just a few kms north of Jaisalmer fort. We had rented a scooter from town and visited the site along with other attractions in the vicinity. This is highly recommended to anyone visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Very interesting cenotaphs
review: Visiting the cremation spots and cenotaphs of the Jaisalmer Maharajas at sunset it very atmospheric.

title: Great Cenotaph of royal family
review: This beautiful set of cenotaphs is just a few kms from Jaisalmer fort. We had rented car and visited the site along with other attractions in the vicinity. This is highly recommended to anyone visiting Jaisalmer. Tip: It can get very warm in summer time. So carry a bottle of water with you. Their is nothing like any shop or source of any things.nice sunset. Again: experience of both tourists and locals would be improved if a major clean up was done.

title: The tranquill cenotaphs
review: Set against the vast expanse of the sky and the never ending plains Bada Bagh is an experience. Carry your camera charged, read the operating instructions on low light photography and lo and behold, you have captured a mesmerising experience. Ignore the ugly windmills

title: Ill maintained Cenotaphs
review: The place is a memorial for Royal family members with each memorial crowned with an umbrella like structure. Not properly maintained and many are crumbling down.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing ruines of an old city in the middle of the desert. The yellow sandstones really seem to be golden in the sun. Lovely place to wander around and relax.

title: Nothing much to see....just a graveyard.
review: Entry to bada bagh is 50 per head and 50 for camera... bada bagh looks gud from distance. So I would advise to just stand near toll gate to click some photos and leave...

title: Touristy, but why not?
review: This tourist activity started with hundreds of tourists in small knots sitting on top of a line swaying camels being led in single file down a track to the dunes.  The camels are interspersed with a few camel drawn open carts carrying small laughing groups who prefer being closer to the ground..

title: impressive
review: Very relaxing, impressive and not at all touristy. a little sad to look at the state of it. Government should take more care of this valuable pearl. Do not miss it!!!

title: Fascinating
review: The out of the way location belied a truly affecting mausoleum site, with beautiful monuments closely placed together giving a real sense of Rajasthani history from the maharajah's angle. The juxtaposition of this site with the wind farm in the background gave a good image of India's current position.

title: Bring a Telephoto Lens and Avoid Fee
review: They have just doubled the fees for entry and for use of camera.  It looks to be pretty much like the Vyas Chhatri Cemetery, and you have a great spot to take photos just outside the gate.  Since we had already been to Vyas, we declined the new fees and took photos from a short distance.

title: magic , neccesary to see
review: half day trip to see close to Jaisalmer magic places. also teples of cmentary just here toi see .the best of Radiastan .you be happy to see old culture, here no tourist, no shops, juzt a past

title: Peace for all.
review: There are very majestic structure created, otherwise not much interest to visit a cemetery. Though the place was not maintained at all there was hefty fee to visit this place. One can get the complete view of the stricture from the entrance (no fee needed). There is not much to do, there are stones all around. Only good part is one can see Windmills in the background that would be very good in snaps.Has the fee been lesser I would have recommended it as must to visit. There is no Toilet/water/snakes facility, so can not spend much time here.

title: Neat to see
review: was interesting to see this cemetery. Some of the tombs are crumbling which is sad to see. Very peaceful, serene place to sit and contemplate if you are interested.

title: Wonderful place!
review: I visited this place twice and it was always as a magic for me. All these old carving constructions, built as memorials to the royal family, are quite impressive! It feels very calming and relaxing here, maybe sometimes even magical. It is a good place to sit and think about life... When the sun goes down, the view is amazing and make to freeze your soul :)

title: Could have really been "Bada Bagh" but sadly it is 'Bad' a Bagh
review: A wonderful set of architecture very very poorly maintained..to the point that it is shocking that such an important monument of the Kings is in such a shabby state with weeds and thorny plants growing all over. Further, lack of guides also leave you wondering why such structures have come up in the first place and what does each cenotaph mean...can be made into a really worthwhile place with some importance being attached to it by the Royal family and the government.

title: Sun down at Bada Bagh
review: The golden light say goodnight to Jaisalmer's royal family every evening ,don't miss.

title: The Royal cenotaphs of erstwhile Maharajs of Jiasalmer
review: Perched on a hilltop, just a few kms from the hustle bustle of Jaisalmer, is bada bagh. It contains a set of royal cenotaphs, or (chhatris) of erstwhile Maharajas of Jaisalmer, starting with Jai Singh II.

title: beautiful architecture but badly kept
review: the architecture is breathtakingly beautiful.but like most of the monuments it is maintained very badly.grass and wild plants has taken over the place and a very beautiful dome has been destroyed.similar cenotaphs are alos there in bikaner which is maintained very nicely.moreover thre is no guide who would explain the history of this amazing palce.

title: Interesting to visit, as part of camel safari excursion
review: We visited the Bada barg mausoleums as a stop in our jeep, on our way out fo town to undertake an evening sunset camel safari. The mausoleums are interesting to have a look around, not much info is present though, but interesting looking none the less, and surrounded by modern windfarm turbines, so the contrast of ancient and new desert Indian life was enjoyable.

title: Gorgeous little gem
review: A wonderful collection of royal cenotaphs densely crowded together on a hillside. Well worth a visit, just a few km drive from Jaisalmer. They are mostly in good shape and the location is lovely. It's further improved by the presence of windmills in the neighbouring "wind farm" and beautiful landscaping, rather green and lush, to one side. I agree with another reviewer who found it an amazingly calm place

title: Photographer's delight
review: I visited this in morning, and realised it would look far more beautiful in the glow of setting sun. My suggestion - plan your trip this towards evening. The guide gives interesting narration of the history - though how much of it is true is anybody's guess :)

title: Must go
review: Barabagh are the place for cenotaphs from the royal family. The architecture is amazing and an awesome place for photography.

title: Rajaon ki nagri, Rajasthan
review: Beautifully carved Muslim designs and structurally sound Hindu architectural wonders. These structures or chhatris or centaphs pay homage to the royals of rajasthan.

title: amazing place
review: i din ve a clear look at it.... does the depression(lake ) ve water body in it... i saw in one of recent photos.. there were some sort of cultivation going on.. wt is it exactly..??????

title: nice view
review: this place is nice to visit in winters.It has a good view and a very peaceful surrounding.

title: Magical
review: This is a stunning place to witness great architecture surrounded by the desolate desert landscape.....sit back and soak up the expanse and take time to reflect.

title: Nice
review: its one of the Attractions in jaisalmer it has golden centophs of all kings and queens and they look pretty good .

title: Great Place, worth the 40-50 Rupees Guide. Terrible maintenance
review: A great place with history dating back to 1100's however, the current king ( owner of the place )  I heard is an alcoholic and does not take interest in maintaining the place.

title: beauti and natural
review: earlier I have seen  this place in bolywood movies. Now I wittnessed myself and family totally different from touristict place. Must visit and experienced with local people Mali

title: One of 3 highlights
review: its unique with history of suti in several hundreds years ago. Only thing is there was lots of poo scattered on the site and walks could be better

title: Hidden attraction
review: This is a beautiful place close to Jaisalmer town. It is not part of the normal Jaisalmer tour routine. It has many umbrella ( Centophs) structures depicting the tombs of the royal family members. Some have been damaged in the earthquake which hit the region some years ago. Overall nice historic place to visit.

title: Family visit
review: This is very interesting place. A patch of greenery in the middle of desert. Te memorials built to various kings are very nice.

title: Interesting
review: Bada Bagh is an old graveyard just outside the city, but it can be easily reached by taxi or tuktuk. it worths a quick visit, we didn't take any guide, but the tuktuk driver has been very kind and told us some info about the place.

title: Cenotaphs and a garden
review: Its located about 10 Kms from the city center, Bada Bagh or big garden was built by the Ruler Maharawal Jait Singh. He though to build a garden in the middle of the desert.

title: Perfect for sunset
review: Expect a lot of tourists around, but this is incredible place to see the setting sun. There is an entry fee that you have to pay.

title: Beautiful cenotaphs in ugly environment
review: The cenotaphs are pretty beautiful and one of the many testaments of the old Kings and their power/riches. However, the surroundings are very ugly (industrial landscape of wind turbines) and do damage the mystical vibe the monuments would otherwise have given.

title: Great photographic sight!
review: Wonderful domes, arches, carved pillars and historical significance. A photographers dream! Be careful to eliminate the wind turbines in the background. Sunset is a great time to let the light create varying effects, colors and shadows against the stone, but don't expect to include the sunset in your temple shots, it sinks below the opposite horizon. Sunrise would be better. There is a minimal entry and camera fee.

title: Best for sunset
review: It's very nice place for sunset and photographs. The best time is afternoon or at sunset time.

title: Nice
review: its one of the Attractions in jaisalmer it has golden centophs of all kings and queens and they look pretty good .

title: Hidden attraction

review: This is very interesting place. A patch of greenery in the middle of desert. Te memorials built to various kings are very nice.

title: Nice
review: its one of the Attractions in jaisalmer it has golden centophs of all kings and queens and they look pretty good .

title: Cenotaphs and a garden
review: Its located about 10 Kms from the city center, Bada Bagh or big garden was built by the Ruler Maharawal Jait Singh. He though to build a garden in the middle of the desert.

title: Beautiful cenotaphs in ugly environment
review: The cenotaphs are pretty beautiful and one of the many testaments of the old Kings and their power/riches. However, the surroundings are very ugly (industrial landscape of wind turbines) and do damage the mystical vibe the monuments would otherwise have given.

title: Perfect for sunset
review: Expect a lot of tourists around, but this is incredible place to see the setting sun. There is an entry fee that you have to pay.

title: Best for sunset
review: It's very nice place for sunset and photographs. The best time is afternoon or at sunset time.

title: Great photographic sight!
review: Wonderful domes, arches, carved pillars and historical significance. A photographers dream! Be careful to eliminate the wind turbines in the background. Sunset is a great time to let the light create varying effects, colors and shadows against the stone, but don't expect to include the sunset in your temple shots, it sinks below the opposite horizon. Sunrise would be better. There is a minimal entry and camera fee.

title: One of 3 highlights
review: its unique with history of suti in several hundreds years ago. Only thing is there was lots of poo scattered on the site and walks could be better

title: Hidden attraction
review: This is a beautiful place close to Jaisalmer town. It is not part of the normal Jaisalmer tour routine. It has many umbrella ( Centophs) structures depicting the tombs of the royal family members. Some have been damaged in the earthquake which hit the region some years ago. Overall nice historic place to visit.
